review.title: Love the atrium, close to everything north & south
review.reviewText: Great service and very accommodating staff.  The room was nice and had an excellent view of the bay.  Brunch was nice with fresh and organic foods... Reasonable at $22 per person.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. It is embarrassing to offer an occupied room upon your arrival. We are truly sorry for this mistake. 

Through our sympathy interviews with lots of our guests, we discovered many travelers nowadays prefer efficient and affordable options rather than the traditional room service concept. With that in mind, we have changed our in-room dining experience where guests can arranged their order to be picked up or deliver to their room in a disposable packing. 

For in room amenities, we offer a list of items for guest to have or borrow, which includes toothpaste, toothbrush, mouthwash, shower cap, dental floss etc. Guest can simply called our operator and have these items deliver to the room. 

We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and we certainly hope this single experience will not deter you from visiting us again in the future.

review.title: Declining
review.reviewText: No cart with a tablecloth and china for room service, just a paper sack with disposable plastic boxes and plastic utensils. No toothpaste! Worst, when I checked in, they gave me a room with someone already in it! A woman who had just showered. She was unhappy to see me. They did give me a $50 credit to make up for it. Wonder what they'll do for her?

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. That can definitely be arranged prior to your arrival. Please let us know when you return and we'll make sure to place that in your room!

review.reviewText: Everything just perfect except we missed the microwave, it would be nice if we have that in the room for a late nite snacks or popcorn

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. review.title: Descent hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText:
Overall hotel is above average,but parking is a very bad.
They have parking lot and by check in they told us that overnight parking is $25.
We stayed for 3 nights and that cost us extra $75.
We agree with that,but you don't have a assigned parking space .
We come on Saturday back to hotel around 8.30 pm and regardless we pay for parking up front,we could not find parking spot.
I was not happy about that and asked  staff what is the solution,
They've told me that is two convention ongoing in hotel and only solution is to get valet parking for extra cost.
I did not care about conventions and insisted to get parking without extra costs.
There is nothing included in price of hotel room.
Very unhappy about that
I will never ever again stay in this hotel.

One more thing : the room is dusty for some reason, I guess it is the airconditionnng system, if you don't touch your phone or any other surface, you would see a layer of dust show up on them, made you want to sneeze..

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText:
We stayed here at the end of a 2 week trip up the CPH. I understand it was recently renovated and everything is very clean and modern. The staff was friendly and the proximity to the airport was just right for catching an early morning flight.
The restaurant is good as well - though pricey for what was served - and the service was a bit strange during the dinner service (but better for breakfast).
One word of caution though - it is a very big hotel! If you have any issues with walking you should request a room near the elevators - otherwise you could be stuck with quite a hike. Side note, the carpets in the corridors have a strange pattern that produce an optical illusion of the floor rushing up to meet you if you look at the floor as you walk.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and the helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks:
Service in the restaurant. 
Restaurant prices.
Access to public transportation.
The charge of $25 per night for parking - this is robbery.

review.title: Get a room close to the elevator
review.reviewText:
Hotel was recently renovated and finishes were nice.  We asked for a bay view and the sliver of view we had sort of qualified.  Of course nothing like the photos, but that's par for the course.  

We were asked if we didnt mind having a room that was a little far from the elevator, and I agreed thinking a few more steps wouldn't kill me, plus i wouldnt have the elevator noise.  Little did I know the elevator was all the way on the other side of the hotel.  I think I probably walked past 100 doors before we found our room.  It really makes you want to murder the architect.  

I'm pretty sure this is how the conversation went when they were designing this place.  ARCHITECT:  So we are going to put the elevator bank right here on the plans. What do you think about this?  OWNER:  That seems ok.  But don't you think our guests with rooms on the other side of the hotel won't have to walk a quarter mile to their rooms?  ARCHITECT:  Screw em.
review.negativeRemarks: Add elevators please.  Or provide segways.  Or a moving sidewalk.  anything!
review.locationRemarks: Not much.  Near the airport so you pretty much have to drive everywhere.

review.reviewText: Construction noise was a bit of an annoyance but occasionally it happens

As a business traveler I expect and use room service in the hotels I stay in.  Got to the hotel after a long day of travel and tried to order room service and was told it wasn't available due to the restaurant being new. They should have told me this when I made the reservation.
Also, there was no shampoo in the room - found this out at 5:30 am when I went to take a shower.  Overall a disappointing experience
review.negativeRemarks: Better quality control on providing amenities such as shampoo. Communicate better when a major service like room service is not available
