review.title: Nice facility.
review.reviewText: The staff was pleasant and friendly. The facility is in the process of renovations. The new rooms are nice. The normal self-parking fee is high. That is surprising if you are a guest, it seems it should be included. great location by the airport. We would definatly stay there again. Did not get a chance to try the new restaurant.

review.title: GFOA CLASS
review.reviewText: This was a business trip and it was very convenient to have the seminar at the same hotel I was staying. The services were very accommodating.

review.title: Nice hotel but being remodeled
review.reviewText: Due to the remodeling a number of amenities unavailable.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, well appointed and very close to airport.  Shuttle service excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: finish the remodel

review.title: Not the hyatt I'm used too.
review.reviewText: Has fallen off a lot no where near other hyatt I've been too.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel close to the Airport. Renovations are almost complete. Good airport shuttle schedule.
Place and staff seem a bit worn down.  Had to search for a clean table to sit down at the bar.

review.title: Weekend Stay
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and looked  almost brand new.  Restaurant (Knuckles Sports Bar) was terrible.  Food was bland and boring & understaffed.  Breakfast buffet was awful.

review.title: Not Happy.
review.reviewText: Except for close proximity to SFO, nothing else is acceptable. Check in process terrible. No room service. Only one cafe. Huge facility but not serving according to name!!!

review.title: Hyatt near SFO
review.reviewText:
Very large hotel undergoing major renovation.  Renovated rooms are very "un'Hyatt" like...nice carpet, superior bed and well-appointed bathroom.

However, the entire restaurant/lobby is under-going renovation as well and is not open for food or drinks.  This should have been pointed out to me at the time of reservation.  Not having a real breakfast or dinner option was annoying and inconvenient.  I may not have decided to stay had I known.  The staff offered no other suggestions such as nearby restaurants as alternatives.

Otherwise Hyatt is doing a good job in upgrading this property.

review.title: The entire hotel was under construction.
review.reviewText:
The entire hotel was under construction.  I did not know this ahead of time, or I would have chosen another hotel.  The lobby was loud, the three floors above me were under construction 7 days a week from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m.  It was hard to sleep in, or relax due to the noise.

I spoke with the staff about this.  I had to ask them to comp my parking, which they did.  They should have offered it to me, without my having to ask.  I asked what they do about this situation, and I was asked if I wanted ear plugs.  Unacceptable.  Next time I make a reservation, I guess I will have to ask if the hotel is under construction.
review.negativeRemarks: Full disclosure about the noise, and offers to comp guests to make them happier.

review.title: 6 minutes to Airport
review.reviewText: Great hotel just minutes to SFO. Excellent location. Very comfortable room.

review.title: This hotel does not offer room service !!!!
review.reviewText: A lot of construction going on inside the hotel, dusty and noisy ......

review.title: Under Renovations
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed to discover the hotel rooms are undergoing renovations and I was placed directly underneath a room that started making loud noises by 9am. I specifically booked a one night stay to get much needed rest away from my high energy young children.  I even mentioned this at check-in.  It was not disclosed to me that there would be loud noises like this. I wouldn't have stayed here had I known I'd be placed next construction. I also wasn't impressed with their room service, breakfast was served cold.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Please be upfront about the noise of construction.
review.locationRemarks: They charge for nightly parking. Location is next to the bay and close to the airport.

review.reviewText: This hotel has a horrible layout and while under construction, it's ridiculous- stay closed!  Disgusting dining option, unacceptable workout facility that can barely fit 4 people, and front desk staff at checkout were rude and irritated with us.

review.title: Oh man!
review.reviewText: Well. It's a nice hotel. I just happened to book a night when the My Lityle Pony convention or whatever you want to call it . Was taking place that night. Not my crowd! But I didn't know?

review.title: under renovation and filthy.
review.reviewText: It should have been noted somewhere that the hotel was being renovated. With that said there is no excuse for filthy hall ways and lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: It should not be open during renovation

review.reviewText: Certain areas of the hotel were still under construction however the newly renovated room was very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is close to the airport and not too far from downtown SF. .
review.negativeRemarks: Hurry up with the renovations.
review.locationRemarks: The town center of Burlingame is very close and has many nice restaurants and shops to enjoy.

review.reviewText:
Our reference was istanbul hyatt regency perfect hotel
This one is totally different
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation should be completed as soon as possible

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Clean place and right by the airport, perfect for leaving early morning.

review.title: Short stay before leaving SF
review.reviewText: Gloria is amazing. She was friendly and very efficient at her job. She did inform us about the construction and the hours of work. She also explained the room service time frame, shuttle schedule, and the hours of operation for the bar. The room was renovated with a large, King size bed with 6 fluffy pillows. We had a view of the atrium which was under construction. A three seater sofa included. The bathroom shower was spacious enough to fit two with a handheld shower head and stationary one. Good counter top space and classic amenities provided. The one bad thing was the bathroom door often obstructed the only full length mirror in the room. Coffee and tea included but not the bottle waters.

review.title: Loud Construction Zone
review.reviewText: Was difficult to enjoy stay with loud construction going on. Had to move to another location to do my work.
review.negativeRemarks: They could have compensated us not charging extra's (parking) for huge inconvenience of hotel - no pool working in hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Millbrae was very nice town!

review.title: Bad customer service
review.reviewText: Customer service was lacking. They do not care about their customers.

review.title: Nice hotel and good location
review.reviewText: Very good food and service.check-in was very fast. !!!!!

review.title: Convenient to airport.
review.reviewText: Under construction when I stayed but will be really nice when completed.

review.title: Hyatt
review.reviewText: They are under remodeling!! Every detail is lost! They should let customers know in order to have a choice of staying there! The restaurant and breakfast is really bad!
review.negativeRemarks: Let people know that is under construction!!

review.title: A Bad experience from the begninning
review.reviewText: Arrived at 8:30pm and was told my room wasn't ready yet.  Again, it was 8:30.  PM.  That is Hours after the room should have been ready!  I was told to "hang out" for 15 minutes and the room would be ready.  I gave them 20 minutes, but when I came back the guy at the front desk said he made a mistake and it would be another 30 minutes.  I finally got in a room at 9:30PM.  To make things even More interesting, the hotel was under construction, with hammering beginning rather early each morning.  So much fun.
review.positiveRemarks: At this point, I really cannot think of a single thing I liked about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough space here to talk about what all could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: The location is close to the airport, but Far from anything interesting to do or see.

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel in under construction, but with all noise and all it was still relaxing.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Due to current renovations, we were upgraded to a suite. Very comfortable.

review.title: Beware of renovations in progress
review.reviewText: You should clearly state when a hotel is being renovated as they lack many key services.

review.title: Great location near freeway
review.reviewText: Great location near freeway and restaurants :)........... definitely recommend the  Hotel

review.title: "Being pretty is a full time job"
review.reviewText: That's what a tiny sign at the front desk said as we walked into our hotel at 1am. I had planned this trip for my boyfriend's birthday a few months ago. All I'm saying is that when you are jack-hammering the "famous" 17-story atrium and the room above my head, LET ME KNOW BEFORE I GET THERE! I'm sure the reno will be stunning but my experience at this hotel sucked. A simple email or phone call letting me know that the hotel is a construction zone would have saved me the frustration of feeling "gotten". Disappointing overall.
review.negativeRemarks: communication with customer when their customers' expectations are CERTAIN to not be met

review.title: Haunted and construction noise
review.reviewText: Excellent staff during check in, room 6106 is haunted. Weird cat noises and light turning off and on in the middle of the night. Woke up at 9am to drilling on the ceiling. Good stay but not worth sleeping past 9am during construction hours I guess. Rooms should be heavily discounted near the construction areas.

review.title: Hotel is close to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The only issue I had was that it was under construction.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText:
Booked a king bed room and instead got 2 double beds. Manager at the reception didn't do anything, just said " Contact Expedia". Done, end of discussion, he turned around and left. 

Rooms are dirty, dust and spider web is everywhere. It's like nobody has cleaned this hotel in months

Bars/restaurants were all closed due to construction, nowhere on the reservation page or hotels website said ANYTHING about it.   When we tried to take the airport shuttle back to the local airport to try and get food there, we were told that transportation was only for arrivals and departure flights...  We were told to take a taxi.

Some of the most ridiculously poor service I've ever seen in a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service on the whole?  Clean it, staff it with polite people.  Don't close all the restaurants/bars at once for construction

review.reviewText: There is a lot of construction and renovation happening now, which is good because the place needs it.  I personally will not go back until it is done. I hope the bar/restaurant is on the renovation list too - surprisingly bad for a large hotel.

review.title: Under renovation. Paint smell, noise
review.reviewText:
The bathroom light sensor is a mistake, light goes off during the shower. 

The paint smell was bad and got me somewhat sick.

review.title: Lovely room!
review.reviewText: Loved the remodeled room, clean, comfortable, quiet. Taylor, the young lady that checked me in was very sweet. Only issue is my iPhone charger disappeared from my room; not sure how that happened. Had to spend $35 on a charger at the hotel shop. Not happy.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: Rooms for some reason are dirty and old looking, layout of hotel is not good although under construction they still have not made it accessible.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: The room was decent, clean but the open area in the center was under construction. It would have been a great area to enjoy had it been done. Limited on the dining at the hotel because of this too. There was no mention of this when the reservations were made.
review.positiveRemarks: room was clean, people were nice
review.negativeRemarks: construction area finished
review.locationRemarks: only close to airport and a small town, nothing decent in walking distance.

review.title: Beware construction: Noisy and Dust-filled Hotel!
review.reviewText: I was deeply disappointed and dismayed to discover that the hotel was under renovation when I checked in for a two day stay. The atrium was extremely dusty and many of the rooms were being redone. As a result, there was construction dust everywhere and noise all around. My room was newly renovated. However, although I had planned to work from my room during the day, the construction noise was so loud that I could not take calls or work  in the room. The noise began early in the morning and continued until around five pm. Although I addressed my concern politely with the staff, they were apologetic and understanding, but essentially did nothing to address the situation. I will never stay there again!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Do not book stays during construction.
review.locationRemarks: Just off Highway 101 near SFO.

review.reviewText: We were not aware that the whole hotel main lobby area was under construction, we shoud have been informed about that.

review.title: Remodeling in progress
review.reviewText: Hotel should notify incoming guests of major remodeling project underway. made for a bad experience.

review.title: Very close to airport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and convenient to airport shuttle every 15 min

review.title: Dust everywhere, and dirty rooms
review.reviewText: When I booked the hotel I was never told that they where under construction. All the pictures showed a different hotel then what we walked into. The rooms had dust everywhere when I later on the bed a could of dust came up. Their was saw dust and dirt in the corners of the room like it hadn't been cleaned right. Their was no exhaust in the bathroom or extra toilet paper. One of the beds in one of the rooms I got had a stain on the bed that was a yellowish color. When I called the front desk they where no help. This is the Hyatt and I expected more. I have traveled all over the country for work and by far this was one of the worst. Oh did I mention the screaming baby across the hall yup that was fun.

review.title: The room is so noisy ...
review.reviewText: The room is so noisy and having a headache I ask them to move a room and they said they will bring the key to our room but more than an hour wait I get tired waiting . Not happy about it !

review.title: Long weekend
review.reviewText: Works great for SFO and San Francisco visits. Easy access to 280 into the city and points south to San Jose.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: there's renovation in the hotel. But all the work from 9:00am to 4:00 pm, as the front desk staff told me. So if you don't stay in the hotel at day time, everything will be ok. The hotel's worth more than 4 stars and the price was only 3 stars . Very good!

review.title: Nice hotel near SFO airport
review.reviewText: Great facility near SFO airport, easy-to-use shuttle to and from airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar/lounge staff was not overly-friendly and slow to serve the paying customers.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to SFO airport. The free shuttle to and from the hotel was convenient. The hotel is currently under construction but the room was comfortable .  We changed our room to face the waterfront. If you're facing the atrium be prepared to hear Jack hammers, drills and saws from 6am-7pm .If you don't plan to spend much time in your hotel room then the construction shouldn't bother you.If you plan to stay here for rest and relaxation I would highly recommend waiting until construction is completed. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable .I would definitely stay here again after construction is finished. Great business center and 24 hr gym access.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText:
The quality you would expect from Hyatt. 
They are renovating however they make up for it.

review.title: view
review.reviewText: Excellent view of the San Francisco Bay.  All of the staff that we encountered were very accomodating and hospitable.

Like the location and the exterior is nice; however massive reconstructions on the interior atrium and several rooms on each floor. My room had a bay view so I was far enough from the Atrium work but could hear construction on the room above as I would leave for the day. Not the end of the world but would have regretted it if needing to sleep in. Folks were super nice and plenty of uber options. I'm sure this place will be a lot better once he construction is done; in the meantime, not a bad place to stay if you just need a pillow to rest your head as your galavant around the city.

review.title: Great...But!
review.reviewText: Beautiful stay, but huge renovations taking place made the air hard to breathe and the smell annoying. Staff was awesome!

review.title: Still undergoing renovation
review.reviewText: Pleasant enough for an overnight; but ongoing renovations have removed any trace of its former mojo: labyrinthine paths to get from check-in to room to restaurant, etc

review.title: Reasonable option for an airport stay
review.reviewText: Had to have a convenient one-night room for a very early flight at SFO.  This did the trick -- wonderfully quick check-in and check-out; good shuttle; nice clean, comfortable, quiet room.

review.title: Do not offer this type of room any longer
review.reviewText: Purchased an "Executive Room" at the Hyatt SFO Airport only to find out when I checked in that this room is called a "parlor" room by the hotel.  While it was a huge room, it did not contain a real bed.  So, I paid almost $ 300 for one night to end up sleeping on a pull out sofa bed.  Shame on Expedia and Hyatt.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Renovation disaster. No Lobby. Loud Construction
review.reviewText: None of the websites, the reservations desk or any reps mentioned a word of the total gutting of the facility's interior. The website, we now realize, showed an architect's RENDERING of what the atrium will look like SOMEDAY. Right now it's bare concrete and I-beams and jackhammers. Dust everywhere.  I overheard a hotel manager telling a decorator only 25% of the rooms are ready.  While our room was very nice and the staff was quite pleasant - we often choose Hyatt because the lobby spaces, atriums and lounges are perfect for spending time with business associates or family from the areas we visit.  NONE of that was possible this time.  What a huge disappointment.  Noisy power tools rattled and hammered all day.  Plastic sheeting lines all the hallway carpets.  Water was completely shut off one day for 5-6 hours from 10 AM on.  I'm pretty irritated to be honest and feel like I got ripped off.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff.  The rooms will be nice - but it was hard to enjoy with all the noise and dust.
review.negativeRemarks: Be honest next time.  A little warning could go along way - instead of the shock in being booked at a construction site.
review.locationRemarks: Not convenient to anything other than the airport

review.title: Wonderful.
review.reviewText: Loved my stay. Hotel was a lot nicer than I expected. Room was very spacious and comfortable. I Will be going back soon.

review.title: OK hotel not quite a 4 star yet!
review.reviewText: The hotel does not deserve a 4 star just yet. I was not expecting all the construction and  it was very disappointing. The courtyard is not as it looks in the pictures because at the moment is under construction and it is completely covered and a mess. The elevators are not working so we had to wait for five minutes to get an elevator that was working. We arrived late and there was an airline crew waiting for the elevator and we waited for ever to get to our room. The room we were assigned was next to a room that was being remodeled and we can smell the paint from the room in construction from our room. We wanted to change rooms but we were informed they were all booked and we needed to wait until the next day.  Our room had an old fridge that was not working we asked the concierge to send someone to assist and the person that came up to our room told us that the fridge was not working but he would send a new fridge. We waited and no fridge. We asked one of the supervisors walking on the hallway to assist us in getting a new fridge because we had a  milk and other food for our toddler and the supervisor said he would send us a fridge and we simply never got one. The next morning the construction workers started the day early at around 8am and they were making so much noise. When they noticed we were still in the room they were considerate and kept the noise level down. We requested a different room but we were informed that there were no other rooms available. Bad Service!
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great but with all the construction you can easily get lost.
review.negativeRemarks: Employees need to improve their on their customer service skills. They can be very rude when you try to request some changes to accommodate your needs
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and great places to eat nearby.

review.title: Good airport hotel great staff uncertain bathroom
review.reviewText: We stayed in one of the "renovated" rooms. Room excellent, bathroom not finished. Newly plumbed sink was plugged, plaster dust, toilet off kilter. But staff at desk anf restaurant were 5 star. Why they use sloppy plumbers and workmen is a mystery.

review.title: nice hotel close to airport and bay
review.reviewText: great hotel but noisy at times due to construction in progress. restaurants across street, highways ,park with breath taking views of bay.hotel charges an extra 200 dollars hold on your credit card to cover extra charges incur during stay.rooms a bit small but sufficient.neighborhood quiet and well kept.San francisco is a beautiful city with a lot of views and attractions to offer all ages.its 15 miles from hotel,airport is 2 miles.
review.positiveRemarks: hotel have free wi- fi ,free shuttle 24hrs to and from airport.hotel s in quiet location and is close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: free parking and free breakfast.Hotel is a bit costly.
review.locationRemarks: american bar and grill across street ,few more rest nearby,park on bay with views

review.title: This hotel sucks
review.reviewText: No restaurant or bar open. Undergoing massive renovation - entire atrium is a war zone. What a joke.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a place where travelers could actually get fed and/or have a drink.

review.title: Airport hotel under renovation
review.reviewText: Hotel atrium & Lobby are under major renovation.  Staff was helpful.
Friendly service especially the restaurant! Great breakfast selection.

review.title: Construction zone
review.reviewText:
I wasn't notified ahead of my visit that the hotel was in the midst of major renovations. Constructiom walls were everywhere, blocking off most of the main floor. There was no real lobby; just service desks. The guest computers were in front of the lobby doors with a cold wind blowing right in. 

I was given a renovated room which was nice, but the constrictiom crews started in the room beside me before 8:30 (I'd been told they start at 9). 

Had I known it would be in this state, I would have chosen a different hotel. It might be fine when renovations are complete, but it's not at all welcoming right now.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: The hotel is under construction so everything inside looks blocked off. I paid for a bay view and got a "freeway" view. The room was very small and bit outdated. Staff was nice and allowed for us to late check out. Very expensive parking - $25 for self parking and $35 for valet.
It was good, our only disappointment was the food service.
Extensive ongoing repair work during the stay. Very noisy from 7 am to 7pm- not highlighted by Expedia on the booking page. Pool and restaurant out of commission.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Over night parking fees too high and no free breakfast provided .

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText:
We upgraded the room for $28 plus tax a night for a "room with view" but the hotel was in construction and our "view" was to there to the construction 
We understand that they are doing renovations to offer us clients more ammenities but during does days rooms with view or not view should be the same price cause there is no view.

review.title: Very close and easily accessible to the SFO
review.reviewText: Shuttle service available wvery 15 minutes during the day. My only complaint was the construction that we were not aware of and was informed at check in. It didn't bother us much as the noise wasn't bad and long as we had expected. Our room window view was the construction site

review.title: Hotel at San Francisco airport...very convenient.
review.reviewText: Hotel is under renevation! Very difficult to tell what it will be like at this point. Could not rate fairly!
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel under major renevation!

review.reviewText: This hotel is under renovation. Very difficult to get around. Water was luke warm. The bed was extremely hard.

review.title: Loud construction noise
review.reviewText: I was not told about construction at the hotel until I checked in. The noise was loud from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. even on Saturday. I had to leave the hotel several times because the noise  was overwhelming.  I would not have booked this hotel if I had known about the noise.
review.positiveRemarks: staff friendly, good shuttle service to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Let customers know about construction before they book.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do nearrby

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: Don't stay until June.  Full renovation underway. Noisy, Cluttered and dirty.

review.title: Location was great for our stay
review.reviewText: Other than the renovations taking place all went well

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Not very quiet, you could hear all outside noises, but not too bad interior noise. Mostly it was the protesters starting at 7:00 am, protesting until 9:00 am. Not sure what the hotel did to them but they were certainly causing a big problem for the hotel. Valet parking was $59 + $9 tax per night. The Expedia sight said it would be $50, either way it is way too much.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff not very attentive.

review.title: Hotel under construction
review.reviewText: The hotel was under construction which caused all the uncomfortable noise while staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were nice, polite, and courtesy.
review.negativeRemarks: Other then the construction going on, a little more attention to detail in room cleanliness. Once entering the room, wrappers underneath the desktop.
review.locationRemarks: Arriving to the hotel was a twisted drive. Road and bridge construction also going on, very unpleasant.

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: Poor gym, pay for parking, breakfast room being renovated and bar is the temporary location so breakfast poor. Great staff and hotel rooms being upgraded. We had an upgraded room, but like all Anerican hotels no water. pressure in thE shower

review.title: Under construction avoid this place until complete
review.reviewText: I would not have stayed here if I had Known it eas being remodeled

review.title: New rooms are nice, but hotel still under renovati
review.reviewText: New rooms were good except the motion sensor light switch in the entryway kept turning on in the middle of the night and when the bill was slipped under the door. Hopefully they can desensitize them.
review.positiveRemarks: All the amenities. Nice bar. Good service to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Light switches. Also wake up call time was 5 minutes different from shuttle bus clock. Missed shuttle by 3 minutes. Fortunately next one scheduled in.

review.title: Our check in experience
review.reviewText:
The reception staff at the time of check in was rude, and unhelpful.
The room was about a mile from the elevator making it extremely uncomfortable and painful to move ou luggage
Except for a sports bar, no restaurants were open
The hotel operator did not even know the opening time for the restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport and frequent shuttles
review.negativeRemarks:
Everything. The staff needs to eb trained better. Elevators not so far from the rooms.
More restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: We had an early flight so chose this hotel due to proximity to the airport. The nice things about this hotel- very nice and clean, great facilities. Also, there is a shuttle at regular intervals that takes you to the airport. The room we had was on the 8th floor. Due to construction on site, it did tend to get a bit noisy during the day, but was reasonably quiet at night (other than traffic on the freeway).

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: Still under renovation, too high price for the noise that is going on now !!

review.title: Under Construction!!! DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL
review.reviewText:
First, that's our first time traveling with our 2-month new born baby girl. Our plan was to spend most of the time in the hotel facilities, but nothing is working right in the hotel. No pool, no restaurant, no whirlpool...no amenities!!!

The first paragraph of the description should explain to customers the situation of the hotel under renovation.

So, we booked for the first time a Resort that we had no privileges, no Fun... Waste of money.
NEVER RENT HYATT

VERY DISAPPOINTED !!!

review.title: Hotel under major construction/renovation
review.reviewText: Disappointed. Despite the fact that the hotel is under major renovation and the noise starts at 9am, including week end, the hotel is dated, the room is small, no accomodities... it was not what I expected from a Hyatt !!

When we checked in for our two nights stay, we were told do not use water until 4:00pm as construction is going on.  Then next morning about 8am drilling sound started. It wasn't comfortable at all. We left the hotel during the daytime and came back late evening. Next day cleaning lady knocking our door even though we had do not disturb sign. I would rank this hotel 2-star.

Hotel is under construction.  I stayed over the weekend and the loud banging started Saturday 8AM and lasted all day.  Sunday, same thing.  I had to physically get out of the hotel because the noise was causing me a headache.

review.title: Construction - Beware
review.reviewText: We were put in a "newly-renovated" room. The odor of carpet adhesive, off-gassing, etc. was unbearable, the bathroom had not been update and the tub had ground-in dirt, old mortar, etc. A nearby room under renovation was left wide open all evening/night, with construction debris and multiple hazards exposed. Poor management, no quality control, very unsatisfying experience. After complaining, the "old" room we were moved to could be considered a generic 2-3 star accommodation, an incredibly long walk from the elevators, a major design flaw of this hotel.

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: So the great thing about this hotel is the proximity to the airport. Also the rooms are remodeled and spacious.

review.title: OK hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel looks old and in need of updating.  Room was clean; bathroom, tub and shower needed to be redone (tiles and caulking looked really dingy and grey; tub had stains as well).
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the hotel; staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms really needed to be updated and refreshed.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText:
It is hard to rate this hotel, because there was so much construction going on that it had almost none of its amenities available.  The staff did everything they could to compensate.  They were attentive and flexible, but they had few resources to work with.

The location was great (for the airport).  It is a good meeting location.  I hope the next time I am there, it will be a great meeting hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Finish construction.  Restaurant.  Fitness center.
review.locationRemarks: We were there for meetings.  The airport location was terrific.

review.title: High Price, Poor Quality
review.reviewText: Paid over $500 per night and have never experienced such a poor relationship between price and value.  The hotel is under renovation - a good thing, as it certainly needs it.  In general. the place is shabby and not clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Where do I start?  The hotel is under renovation - long overdue, I would say.

review.title: under construction, very difficult even to get to
review.reviewText:
in room service? practically "nothing" THE MENU IS SO "NOTHING",  the person answered the call was so terrible cold and harsh.
room design is horrible.
WILL NOT GO BACK THERE.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: GET TO THE AIR PORT

review.title: Hotel Under Construction
review.reviewText: We were never advised that the hotel was under construction. Its is also 15 minutes from the airport and when we were dropped off we had to lug our suitcases 0 yards since the front door is closed...very disappointed!
review.negativeRemarks: Finish construction and dont offer hotel as if there is nothing going on!

review.title: Hotel is under renovation which is overdue
review.reviewText: It should've been renovated 30 years ago. The noise all over. Can't rest at all. They charged over $240 for the night in this conditions. Also there was some hair in the bathtub. Not what you expect from Hyatt. The hallways and doors look like from another era. It will take years to bring this hotel up to 4* standard.
review.negativeRemarks:
A lot of renovations required. Long walk from elevator. Elevators should be added.
The bar like the small town bar. Not very classy.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: I picked this Hotel because I had stayed there before and it was beautiful. I had no idea the Hotel was under construction. The noise started at 7:00am. Everything was blocked off. You could get to the elevator and your hotel room and that was it. However, I can live with the construction and without the beautiful atrium courtyard for a brief stay. The topper to this stay was there was no running water in the bathtub/shower. The bathroom sink had water but not the tub. We called the front desk and there was no answer. We called the concierge, they answered, transferred us to the front desk and no answer. We tried four times to get someone to answer. We became extremely frustrated and packed up and left. When I checked out the lady at the "front" desk was very pleasant and took care of our dinner charge on our room. However, I will now always try the shower faucet when I first arrive at a Hotel to make sure it works before I settle in.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Notifying patrons that the hotel is under construction upon booking the reservation.
review.locationRemarks: It is on the bay so it is a wonderful place.

review.title: Wonderful staff
review.reviewText: We arrived on New Year's Eve completely sick with the flu. The  staff took pity on us and gave us an unsolicited upgrade to a suite with a bay view. It turned out to be a godsend with two very sick people. There was extensive construction going on so I'm sure they had the space but it was a truly wonderful gesture that made a huge difference to us since we didn't leave the room until the day we flew out. All of the staff were welcoming and super accommodating with any request. I'm sure they were super focused on customer service because of the inconvenience of the construction. Definitely plan to stay here again!

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: While place torn apart. Would have made a different choice for that much money.

review.title: They are remodeling.  Right now it is not a 4 star
review.reviewText: Stay was great.  Check in was great.  The entire atrium is torn up.  If it was a work day it would be very noisy.
The hotel was in total renovation. Just one terrible restaurant. A steakhouse close to a motel is better. To far from san francisco center. Overall I'm totally desapoiting.

review.title: Loud construction noise
review.reviewText: They are undergoing construction inside the hotel. I woke up to loud hammering and drilling at 8:00am coming from right above my room, which shook the walls of my room. Extremely unpleasant. The noise lasted 3 hours in the morning. I was offered to switch rooms but I was checking out that day anyways, so there was no point. Room amenities were ok but slightly outdated. There was no lobby area like the pictures online because of the construction.

review.title: Not a comfortable night stay
review.reviewText:
Hotel was going through construction. This was not advertised during the time of reservations.  I booked the room for 3 people so I expected two queen beds.  At arrival, I was annoyed by the construction and on top of that I was told that Hyatt doesn't have queen beds only full size beds.  
To accommodate, I was offered complimentary parking. So I do appreciate the customer service. I don't appreciate being surprised about the construction and the small beds.

review.title: Construction Zone
review.reviewText: This is normally an excellent hotel, which I have stayed at before. But it turned out that they are going through a major renovation. Instead of the usual view of the bay and airport or of the atrium, our room had a view of a construction site. At 7:15 AM in the morning, I could hear them working. Also, at 10:00 PM at night, I could hear a strange vibrating noise that would start and stop and then start up again. I am sure after the renovation is finished, the hotel experience will be returned to it's former glory. But that's not what it is now. The hotel staff was excellent as usual though. I would have chosen another hotel if I knew this was going on. But I was not informed.
review.locationRemarks: Relatively close to S.F. and all the attractions there. Close to downtown Menlo Park. The very close downtown Burlingame has many places to eat.

review.title: Smelly smell
review.reviewText: Construction going on, room smelled like BO, overnight parking costs 25$, when I asked for complimentary items, they didn't bring all of it
We had a great time while we were stay in this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we definitely will be back next time!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Extensive renovation going on.  Atrium gutted.
Only one restaurant (sports bar) open.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
Good hotel. 

Got everytging you need to have a comfortable stay.

review.title: Not coming back
review.reviewText: The room was outdated and disappointing. No access to the nice hotel lobby as shown in many commercial pictures, either. We guessed that they were going through some major construction but there was no explanation or sign. On the day we left, we had unexpected fee on the receipt, being charged $25 for parking 30 minutes in the garage. In the end, it was taken care of by one friendly staff but we wish we were informed more properly about parking policy while checking in. The cleaning lady almost shouted at the door and quietly asking her to come back didn't work. We had to open the door and let her see us in the middle of getting ready to convince her to send away. The most unpleasant experience was the shuttle driver who took us to the airport. He was extremely unfriendly and seemed to be driving very reluctantly... not helpful for the hotel. Except for two friendly staffs working on the Christmas morning at the (probably temporary) reception desk, our stay at this place was unpleasant and disappointing, ruining our general expectation for Hyatt Regency.

review.title: Good solid value in SFO. Clean property.
review.reviewText: Attentive staff. Comps your parking and may throw in free breakfast due to current hardly noticeable construction.

review.title: Unfortunate extensive renovation
review.reviewText: Limited food service at bar, extensive renovation noisy between 9 am and 7 pm.

review.title: good location, price too high
review.reviewText: I spent more than 200$ for 1 night and 25$ for parking. First time find a airport hotel charge for parking and at that high price. I asked for slippers and ropes but they told me they didnt have. Fine hotel but not worth.

review.title: I have stayed at better 2 star hotels
review.reviewText: Let's start off with the good, then we will go to the bad and then the ugly. The good, parking for my oversized work truck and great doormen. The bad, no coffee on 2 of the mornings of the 4 night stay. A 4 star hotel should have coffee 24/7. I also think they should have at least some baked goods at a minimum in the morning. Much lesser hotels have a nice breakfast. The room, not bad, but not good. Toilet paper holder inoperative, really? Pull the roll and it hits the floor. Old shower/bath fixtures, hotel is under renovation and it needs it. Housekeeping couldn't even bother to replenish the soap. Had to find some buried in my suitcase from another hotel on the last morning to take a shower.The bar, overpriced watered down drinks, stick to beer and even that is high. Hit or miss with bartenders, some very good and wonderful, some not so much. Insulting, I am a working man, so I don't have a 3 piece suit on, still deserve to be treated with respect. This place lost a lot of sales from me for their service, not just drinks but food. A very disappointing experience. Stepped up to pay more for a room to have a decent place to stay for the week, that wasn't the case, nothing special. I don't think I will stay here again. There are much better choices. Just didn't meet any standards of a 4 star hotel in my book, I would be gracious in giving it a 3 star rating, more like a 2.5 in my book.

review.title: Open During Renovation?!
review.reviewText: Terrible experience!  Hyatt took bookings without informing customers that they were in the midst of a major renovation/construction project. There were no lights on in the hallways, no AC operational in the room, and jack hammers operation above us. We finally got the hotel to cancel our reservation and refund our payment. We then had to scramble to find an alternate hotel in the area. Hard to believe Hyatt would act that way, and Expedia would not be aware of the construction activity.

review.title: CLOSE TO AIRPORT
review.reviewText: Was not told hotel is under construction, lots of "jackhammering" going on, lots of noise and dust. key card would not work on first try had to go back down stairs and wait in line again. (setback after flying). pay for parking when all around the block in both directions free parking no restrictions. working on the water system turned off during the day- another set back. when I left on day 1 of a two day stay paid for parking at keyoisk and was charged to my room as well had to get receipt when doing so you only have a 20 minute to get out of garage. charged me another $6 after I already paid setback 3. when returning back for my second night stay my key once again did not work went back down stairs setback 4 was told my key was only good for 1 day but records showed that I was booked for 2 nights? hopefully the will correct these conditions not sure if I will use them again.
review.negativeRemarks: complete construction
review.locationRemarks: visit the wharf pier 39 down town.

review.reviewText: Was expecting a lot more from a Hyatt Regency property

review.title: Great location, great town.
review.reviewText: The front desk young man who checked us in was polite and effecient.  Hotel was clean and room very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel, met all of our needs. The best part is that they have 24hr shuttle to airport. Made it easy to make 5am flight with family!

review.title: Great Customer Service at check in
review.reviewText: Kateryna was very sweet and helpful. I liked the infused water. Plenty of parking. Friendly and courteous door people.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the bottled water that is put in the room should be free rather than $4.00. I can get a gallon for 99 cents at Walmart.
review.locationRemarks: Short 20 min drive from SF

review.title: Near airport
review.reviewText: Close to airport with great shuttle service. Nice clean room at a reasonable price

review.title: Dated Hotel, AC and Water both had major issues
review.reviewText:
Dated Hotel, AC and Water both had major issues that led to difficulty showering and sleeping.
Would not recommend this hotel.

The staff was very friendly. Every staff member I walked by would greet us. They even sent up milk and cookies for my girls. 

I could not give the facility a perfect score because they are currently undergoing a major renovation. However we could not hear any noise from our room. 

Close and convenient to the freeway and airport. Again could not hear any noise from our room.

review.title: Restaurant was not open
review.reviewText: There was a big renovation during my stay. The restaurant was closed. It was a shame I had to go out and eat in the third rate food when I stayed in the best hotel.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Disappointed, thought hotel rooms would be a nicer than they were

review.title: Awesome hotel close to the airport and the water.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay.  I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.  The ambience was awesome. There are restaurants in the hotel and a few surrounding the hotel. The room was clean and furnished just right.  The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Parking extra?
review.reviewText: Hotel was great... booked on expedia.... BUT when I arrived, to find a $25 self parking fee OR $30 valet fee... Really? You would think they could have complimentary coffee or something...
The staff were very accommodating.  AWESOME customer service.

review.title: Not up to the normal expectations of a Hyatt Hotel
review.reviewText: Lighting in rooms were terrible, shower curtain had mold on it, rooms were stuffy and very dusty.  The chairs in the Restaurant were very stained and not kept clean to the point you really did not want to sit on them.  The food was good in the Restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and lighting in the rooms especially the bathroom which is one of the most important especially for women.
review.locationRemarks: Did not really go anywhere but the store which was way too far to try and get some essentials.

review.title: Not the room as advertised on Expedia
review.reviewText: Booked a double room hotel room and they do not offer it

review.title: Great service for a great price
review.reviewText: I booked via expedia, got a good price and it was worth the money. Nice, clean hotel with great service.

review.title: needs a bit of modernization
review.reviewText: not the room i expected for the amount i paid. too overrated.

review.title: Nice, clean, quiet
review.reviewText: Nice, clean and quiet in spite of ongoing conventions.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: waited an hour for the shuttle at 11 pm - and in the morning the driver simply quit! the hotel is old, the walls paper thin, the late night staff unhelpful. They did comp e breakfast and ended up sending people by cab in the am as the van driver went awol. I would have been better off at the super 8 and saving a lot.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Very good experience if you need to be close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: I have not time to review it

review.title: Good Hotel - Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Good Hotel - Close to the Airport - Good Room Service

review.title: Better Travel Light if Bayview Room
review.reviewText:
I had my family with me hotel is great but elevators are far from where Bayview (More Expensive) Rooms are just for the view. 

Dragging 7 Suite cases and not enough luggage carts and the Bell hop spoke zero to none English for some odd reason for a Hotel in SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators and easy access to rooms.
review.locationRemarks:
Great Location easy for staying near Airport. 
Walk along the Bay and great restaurants all around.

review.title: nice, close to the airport
review.reviewText: Great !!! Everything was as expected...Would be happy to stay here again ...
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: it was okay
review.reviewText: the hotel looked really nice, both the rooms and the atrium/courtyard. however, it wasn't as nice to stay in as expected. it took me somewhere between 20-30 mins to check in as there were only two staff at the register and for some reason, it took forever to handle two customers. It wasn't like there was a line or anything. it was just purely slow. then the room wasn't that clean either. I think the beds are fine. but my mom told me the carpet is really dirty as she could tell from her slippers. Well, I would still recommend it over the Bay landing hotel which is like 500 ft away and slightly cheaper as bay landing is soooo old and only slightly cheaper (at least in my bookings).

review.title: Nice hotel close t airport
review.reviewText:
Checking in was bad
1- they gave us a room on level 7 that was occupied !!
2 went back down again to complain , they gave us a room. On level 6 , a single bed not as we had booked , a twin bed
3 went back down. T o reception again
T complain , they gave us a room on level 5
That was fine
We had a great time and hotel provided us a phenomenal base location and great shuttle services.  Will definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location, great service in hotel shuttles to/from downtown Burlingame and to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Advertise the hotel shuttle from the CalTrain station as a transportation option - we didn't know of the shuttle before arriving to hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - shuttle and buses provided us all the transportation we needed.

review.reviewText: Minimum 50 characters. Minimum 50 characters. Minimum 50 characters. Minimum 50 characters.

review.title: Hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Nice walk along the shore line. Very nice atmosphere at the atrium level. Speedy check in and out with courteous. Worry free complimentary shuttle to & from airport.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located close to the airport with free shuttle to close by town center.

review.reviewText:
It was noisy that people were talking in a hallway. 
Hotel shuttle missed us at the SF airport, so we had to wait another 20 minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: People at the front desk was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom vent wasn't really working.

review.title: Large, older, airport hotel - EXPENSIVE parking!
review.reviewText:
Needed to stay in the Burlingame / San Mateo area and this hotel was available. Bed and linens were not as comfortable as another hotel I stayed at the night before.

Room AC kept shutting off in Auto mode (motion sensor)...had to switch it to medium or low otherwise too stuffy while sleeping.

$25 per night for self-parking and $30 for valet. My standard Ford F250 would not fit into the parking structure so I had to valet for $30 plus tips. 

Come on Hyatt!! $30 for overnight guest parking??? It should be FREE considering the room rate charged!
review.negativeRemarks: Outdated old decor, furnishings and style. Uncomfortable bed and linens. AC that kept turning off. Ridiculous parking charges.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO Airport and many businesses in the area.

review.reviewText:
Very nice facility, excellent staff.  Nice to be close to the airport  (free shuttle) and very close
to San Francisco.  That gives the option of a quick trip into the City for entertainment and dining,
without having to stay right in the city.
review.positiveRemarks:
Close to the airport, very nice facility,  easy run into San Francisco
as an option for entertainment or dining.

review.title: A terrible staff at the check in counter( Gloria).
review.reviewText:
A very bad experience at the check in counter ( Gloria). She was very rude and non-respectful. I asked for her card, she showed me her name badge as if she is above all and non caring.
When again happen to cross her path from the parking lot to hotel entrance she stared down again as if she had some revenge again me.
Non a good experience.

review.title: The room was very nice. I loved the Atrium.
review.reviewText: The service was impressive.Your staff was very friendly the food was excellent.

review.title: Three day visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
From checking in the service was friendly and very professional. Customer service could not be faulted. Dealt with Carlene, Walter and Gloria at reception who were great ambassadors of the hotel.
Although a little bit away from The Wharf the fantastic service made up for it. Excellent value.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. Please accept my sincere apology for the poor interaction you had with our front office staff and the delay on bell service. Your experience with us is very important to us and your feedback has been shared with my Executive Housekeeper & Front Office Manager for review.

review.title: Never coming back
review.reviewText: I took advantage of an Expedia offer and was assigned a room right next to the highway. I was too hungry to ask for a room change right away, so I had dinner before going back to the front desk. The front desk person who served me seemed like she was willing to assign a better room to me, but a more senior person, Claudia, prevented her from doing so because she claimed that housekeeping is gone for the day and the hotel was sold out, and it was too late for me to ask for a room change. I was fuming when I saw housekeeping still working on my floor when I headed back to my room, so I called the front desk again, and they said the only room they could offer to me was one with a pull-out bed. I just felt like the hotel management cares more about their own conveniences rather than the guest experience. In the morning, I called for bell service and had to wait around 20-25 minutes, call the front desk multiple times before someone arrived. Dated rooms, terrible service, never coming back.

review.title: Good for layovers
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel because it was near the airport, it provided shuttle service, and Internet. Nevertheless, the area is not good for visitors. Overall, I was satisfied.

review.title: was nice, close to the airport.
review.reviewText: very good price for a four star hotel.  check secret price.
review.negativeRemarks: they charged parking; and not coffee in the room.
review.locationRemarks: easy access to highway and you can go anywhere from there.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Got the room for a good price but there was the hotel parking that was $25. / night
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, close to where I worked.  Staff very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Notify customers of parking fee prior to booking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO

review.title: Great weekend retreat.
review.reviewText: Centrally located with easy access to airport and the Bay area. The staff were wonderful.

review.title: I didn't stay this time
review.reviewText: I couldn't stay there this time. As I mentioned in my last review, the hotel did not allow me to claim a reimbursement even though I had given them a couple of weeks notice. I hadn't noticed the fine print when I reserved with expedia: no reimbursement if you cancel. I had stayed in the hotel before and it's OK if you're between flights, but obviously I would not recommend it after this experience.

review.title: Not too far from San Francisco
review.reviewText: Needed a hotel room for a good night's rest that was a little bit south of San Francisco. Finding the entrance to the hotel was a bit of a challenge, but once we found it everything went smoothly. There is a $25 per night parking fee, but because the hotel was great and the price reasonable that wasn't much of an issue. Great Sunday buffet!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms, great buffet, nice staff. Wonderful experience. The checkout and checkin was painless!
review.negativeRemarks: Well, the parking could be a bit cheaper - though it was quite full when we left. Perhaps some more room amenities - but those are just fluff.
review.locationRemarks: Beach walk and a great science center. Not too far from San Francisco.

review.title: Great location great staff!!!
review.reviewText: Awesome!!!! Great staff great location. Most def stay there again.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: If it wasn't for the bad traffic going to the hotel from highway 92 only 90 minutes, but it wasn't the hotel's fault so I had a good experience being at the hotel nice and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for the entire bay area. Dining and events.

review.title: nice just didn't stay long enough
review.reviewText: disappointed in having to pay 25.00 per night per car .... really that is absolutely ridiculous and when the hotel clerk was discussing with me because I asked if other people are upset. When I checked in i was told about the 25.00 but she did not say per night!! So when I was checking out and received parking bill. Whoa! the clerk said yeah people are not happy  but most people are on business so somebody else is paying.......... well that comment and those kinds of practices are whats wrong with this world.... because guess who is really paying all of us and quite frankly i think our money is spent better else where. I will not stay and pay for parking again & the whole window not opening is stupid. We have been on planes with fake forced air now we have to to deal w/ hotels with fake forced air. The windows not opening is a trend in the business well that to me is just stupid.

review.title: SF hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. A little on the expensive side but extremely amazing staff! They really went out of the way for me. Perfect after a long 12 hour flight! Parking is $25 per day. Food was good too. Close to the airports. Free shuttle. Short drive from beautiful Downtown San Fransisco. Overall, it was great!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: We stayed just one night. It was close to all we needed and it was very clean. The staff was courteous and very helpful. Our room was very quiet and very nice.

review.title: Convention Hotel
review.reviewText: No access to bars, convenience items or poolside services
review.negativeRemarks: Convenience store. Lobby bar. Keurig coffee in rooms. Upgrade pool area
review.locationRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Convenient and easy
review.reviewText: The park and fly for this hotel is great the shuttle is quick and the valet has your car ready when you arrive from the airport. The staff and rooms are wonderful we are a family of  4 and we will be back

review.title: Very Nice Hotel close to City and Airport
review.reviewText: As always a Very Friendly Staff and Well Kept Facility

review.title: Highly overpriced dated hotel under construction
review.reviewText: I had a business meeting at the Hyatt, so I figured I would just spend the night after a cross-country flight. I was surprised that the room was $380/night. I mean this is St. Regis / Four Seasons money. Boy how disappointed I was. The hotel is livable, don't get me wrong, but it's more like a $120/night at best. It's old, the rooms are dated, the food ($20 for breakfast buffet) is doubletree / days inn quality, the common areas look tired. It's just a sad place. So my advice, if you have a meeting at SFO or even at the Hyatt, stay elsewhere.

review.title: Great shuttle service to and from airport.
review.reviewText: Good timely shuttle service. Also good sports bar

review.title: Hotel is outdated, too expensive surely garage
review.reviewText:
We booked 3 nights which is not average.
For  The payed price the service at the desk is terrible!!!!Hottel is well situated near airport. 
25 $ extra for the car in garage is not done for clients... Also when you arrive there is no place for a short stay of the car, to register in the hotel.  The fact we booked through expedia (X3) , we had to face that every question we asked was to much and blocked off by staff.  
You need at each moment to tip people for everything ... The lady at the info desk was weird and in bad mood, she was very rude answering a question about the shuttle bus.  For the price range we think there must be better service with a smile....  We had to bear our luggage out of the garage, no elevator working....(after ten days when we came back it still was not repared !!!)
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport but near industrial zone.....

review.title: Convenient hotel to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Upscale hotel with frequent shuttles to SFO airport. Has more corporate / convention atmosphere than family. Large outside pool but little pool furniture and few umbrellas. Had to walk through meeting rooms hallway to get to pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool area
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO, but not bayfront

review.title: Convenient shuttle service to and from SFO airport
review.reviewText: Some construction work was going on but noisy only between 9 and 5. Nothing within walking distance but shuttle to airport is frequent. Less frequent (hourly) is shuttle to the shops in Burlingame where many good eateries are.
review.positiveRemarks: Free and frequent shuttle to airport. Good rate when turned up as mystery hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: more frequent shuttle to shops. Less steep rate for parking overnight.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do nearby. Bayshore walk is short and cut off to the south by private industrial land.

review.title: Read the fine print!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was OK if the aim is to rest a few hours at a nearby place following a long airport trip. But I booked for two nights in between trips (on Aug 15th and then Aug. 31st) and then I had to cancel the second night due to a change of plans. I gave them plenty of notice -- about 10 days -- but they said I would not get reimbursed anything because I had booked a "no refund" room (I didn't know that when I booked and paid, perhaps it was written in the fine print). Expedia tried to phone the hotel so get at least a partial refund but the hotel said no. They could easily have done so without cost to themselves because when I booked the room I was told they had a full house and my room was the last one. In short -- probably my fault in the strict legal sense, but not the kind of service one expects from a top hotel that aims to accommodate the needs of customers.
review.negativeRemarks: See abovel

review.title: Comfortable stay near the airport
review.reviewText:
Quiet and comfortable facility including the room and gym/pool. Always kept clean. 
The access is great too with airport shuttle. Nice running track along the beach and also Burlingame in just 15min walk. Good for a morning run/walk and breakfast at cafs.
review.negativeRemarks: There could be a wider variety of amenity or newspaper service considering the price
review.locationRemarks:
Location is awesome especially with airport shuttle
I enjoyed the street around the Burlingame.

review.title: Pricey, yet quiet and nice
review.reviewText:
Staff was great, the environment was warming, and the comfortable room.
The Facilities however are horrible. The pool was small (3ft deep maybe fitting 5 people with out invading people space) small and the Fitness center was disappointing (As big as my deluxe room, cramped and with dumbbells up to 45lbs including a 4 in 1 station).
Suggestion: 
If your here to vacation in San Fransisco, try getting a room inside the city for a few bucks more or at a holiday inn for a few bucks less to save the hassle of paying for a 20-30 min ride to any of sights that San Fran has to offer.
If your here on Business then this is the place for you.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, the staff and maid service were above and beyond helpful & informative
review.negativeRemarks: All elevators are on one corner of the entire hotel, inconvenient. Brunch buffet didn't have a price so I was shocked to see a $110 bill for 2.
review.locationRemarks: South of San Fran Airport, and about 20 min (without traffic) to the city. Recommend using UBER app to travel

review.title: Hotel is OK but doesn't do the Hyatt name justice.
review.reviewText: Long wait at check in.  Elevator in garage didn't work.  Got woke up at 6:30 am by wake up call but never asked for one!  Room key didn't work at the garage gate.  Room was very clean.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Located close to airport. Wished the pool was located on premises where it would NOT require guests walking through the lobby/reception area. Additionally, would be nice if guests could open door/window facing atrium.

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText: We had a few problems with our room due to a very late check in. However the attentiveness of the staff made up for any inconvenience.

review.title: Unpleasant
review.reviewText: Our room at first glance was nice but as my family and I settled in I noticed there were large amounts of dust covering every surface in the hotel room. The desk, night stands, the bathroom counter, COVERED in a thick layer of dust. I have allergies as do my children and this room triggered an allergy attack. Since each surface was covered in dust I imagine the pillows and bed covers were as well. When room service brought up our breakfast I was too grossed out to eat my meal because as the trays were set out there was dust blowing around. I took it upon myself to clean our room. Not something I really want to do when I'm on vacation- and I NEVER go on vacation so I was really upset that a hotel of this rating and such great standards let this happen. I also found a note that was signed saying that our room was prepared personally. It absolutely was not. The hotel was also under construction and it was LOUD. There was a jack hammer cutting through cement and thats all I could hear while at the hotel. I would never stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel for SFO and San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Overall very good hotel.  Free wifi, rooms are clean,  excellent beddings,  towels adequate, bathrooms well supplied.  Gym is very good.  However on top of your daily room rate they charge for self parking ~ $25 per day.
Very nice, clean, quiet room for a decent price.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are nice, the AC is quiet, it is very clean and the restaurant on the Atrium is very open and welcoming.  The food is good, but pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: Typical Hyatt: they nickel and dime you for every single little thing.  $25.00 parking fee is annoying ($30 for valet).

review.title: Very nice hotel on the water.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was beautiful with a big central atrium.  Loved being able to take nice long walks right along the water on a walking path. Convenient shuttle bus picks you up in front of the hotel and takes you to downtown Burlingame. A must visit. Great shops and restaurants. Also, free shuttle busses to and from the airport. I would definitely stay here again. Pool needs some new lounge chairs though. Pool is nice.

review.title: nice  hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Convinience shuttle to and from the airport. rooms are fair.
review.positiveRemarks: reasonable price and close to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: not much thing can be down around or near the location. not even  a decent restaurant to eat a reasonable meal.

review.title: Nice, close to the airport and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great service and the staff were very friendly and helpful in every way.  I would recommend to a friend.

review.title: Clean and staff was so kind.
review.reviewText: Stayed the night and took the BART to the City. We left the car and took a shuttle.

review.title: Quick overnight stay.
review.reviewText: Disappointed in restaurant access. Shuttle bus was a great convenience.

review.title: SFO Hyatt Regency is a surprise...
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located minutes from SFO via the hotel shuttle bus.  These busses run roughly every 10 minutes from the airport exit directly to the hotel itself.  From the airport, anyone can quickly catch the BART (the primary public transportation mode in San Fran) to other parts of the San Fran bay area (even to Oakland and Fremont!).  

The hotels is nicely set up with minimal amenities (ie out door pool, gym, small gift shop and a few restaurants).  Upon arriving guests checking in will be greeted with an expansive atrium that allows a lot of natural light into the main part of the lobby.  

Initially I thought the hotel would be loud because of the proximity to the runway (it's really just across the street).  But I was mistaken.  The beds were great and the rooms were nearly sound proof.  I don't even recall hearing the planes (we were in the atrium rooms).  

Overall, this was a good spot.  Perhaps more ideal for business travellers because of proximity to the airport/Santa Clara/freeways etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was the main draw.  Its a bit out of the way (ie fisherman's wharf, golden gate bridge) but that's the whole point.  The hotel was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Some staff members (at the front desk) were rude.  An attitude adjustment is needed.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transportation, SFO, close to San Fran downtown, AT&T stadium, Levi's Stadium.

review.title: parlor suite was paradise
review.reviewText: We had originally booked a two room suite but upon arrival only got a room with two double beds Expedia of course messed up again but I did upgrade to a parlor suite and it was absolutely amazing

review.title: Very nice and clean hotel. Great staff!
review.reviewText: Great service and very helpful during our stay. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel clean , good service 
Close to the airport.

review.title: Convenient location - close to the airport
review.reviewText: All Ok, clean, well maintained, good food, easy parking
The hotel was nicely maintained with a pleasing atmosphere. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. The rooms were clean and smelled fresh. Good choice for an airport stay.

review.title: Won't be back....
review.reviewText: Seems that because I booked my room through Expedia; I was treated as a second class citizen. I have stayed at Hyatt's before with no complaints; maybe it is this location. Housekeeping was terrible...no wash cloths one day, no towels the next...shampoo one day not the next...just the basics that you expect. They fell short.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to the airport, timely shuttle service, free wifi. Everything we needed. We arrived late, went to sleep and got the early morning shuttle.
If you are leaving from San Francisco this hotel is just 5 minutes off the airport. The food in the bar is good and the hotel is OK, maybe a little too expensive.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText:
At first, there was a problem with the reservation. I reserved and paid for 5 days but the hotel was charging the first night (the one that was cancelled without charges). Expedia made the change with the hotel directly and sent me an email regarding the change. The hotel did not make the change in their system and the reservation manager fixed everything. So at the end, everything was OK.

I was staying there for a convention.  Everything was OK.  One time, the hotel changed the food, that was not good.
but overall, it was good.

The free shuttle from airport to hotel is very much appreciated by all.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nice and clean. The personnel was nice.
review.locationRemarks: There is not much around that hotel.

review.reviewText: We were only there for one night but it was great.
Great place to stay if you want to be close to SFO Airport.

review.title: From Tijuana
review.reviewText: What a nice hotel to stay in just be prepared to pay for parking. I guess a city this size parking is a huge issue. Overall very nice hotel

review.title: Nice hotel and services
review.reviewText: stayed 2 nights in room 7123 across from the elevators. The motors made a lot of noise and we needed ear plugs to sleep.  This room was the least expensive and listed as Expedia "Best Value" ; now I know why.  I won't trust Expedia "Best Value"  anymore.  This is the second time this happened to me (below average room or poor location )   Other than that, breakfast was excellent and hotel services, gym and pool are top notch.  Cons:  Shuttle driver was not happy with his 1$ tip. I regret giving him anything at all. bottled water was not complimentary ($4)

Hotel was not too far from San Francisco main attractions (about 20 minutes). Staff was extremely polite. Nice rooms. Buffet was ok, but overpriced. The air conditioning in the room was not working well. It would turn off.

review.title: Beautiful facilities, attentive staff
review.reviewText: My wife and I had been staying at the nearby redroof and were not thrilled with its obscure location and overworked staff, and switched to the Hyatt for just $30 more per night.  What a difference!  The Hyatt has actual restaurants and a gorgeous attrium, plus is close to several nice dining venues within walking distance. Everything else is at least two stars above the redroof, which Expedia anomoloisly grades 3.5 stars to the Hyatt's 4.0 stars. the Hyatt airport shuttle is also twice as frequent and dedicated to the Hyatt, in contrast to the redroof shuttle which runs just twice an hour and shares with another hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi could be faster. It was limited to just 2Mbps during our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Airport-industrial, but a block from the beautiful bay shore walk with several nice parks within a few blocks.  Nearby BART station gets you downtown.

review.title: Amenities Overpriced
review.reviewText: Food and bar options are overpriced. breakfast buffet is $20 per person. Concierge helped us with a taxi to Fisherman's Warf, she quoted us an appox cost of $58 before gratuity. We didn't hit any traffic and had a smooth ride into town, but the fee before gratuity was $20 more than quoted. She also said we could call the taxi driver for a ride home until 10:00 p.m. She gave us his business card. We called him at 7:30 and he didn't answer. We left messages for him and he never returned our call. It didn't take us long to realize that we were on our own and took public transportation. It worked out but we wish we had know that we would take public transportation ahead of time so we could have allowed for more time. We didn't get back to the Hyatt until 12:30 a.m. with three children.
review.negativeRemarks: more affordable breakfast options

review.title: Nice hotel close to the SFO Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is located at the great location including easy access to the airport, nearby towns and San Francisco city. The hotel is ok but we are a bit dissaponpinted about the qualities which are not up to the typical "Hyatt" including everything. Especially the food quality needs to be improved.

review.title: Booked me in to an occupied room.
review.reviewText: Booked me in to an occupied room at 12:30am.  Waited until 1:20 to get me in a room.  Got almost no sleep because I had a 6 am flight.  No refund given at all.  One free breakfast.  Whatever!  I won't stay there again.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very busy with two large parties. Staff was slow took over 20 min to check in. Was charged a $50 parking fee & didnt even have a car. Disputing this fee. Lots of noise in hall after 1am. Not happy as had a 6am flight.

review.title: Devil is in the details
review.reviewText: Cleaning crew needs a stepping stool, light and mirror, anything above 6ft was dirty and has been for a long time. The maintenance dept needs to fix the fixtures,like the slider that took two people and alot of hassle to get it open,the loose shower faucet. The area by the kitchen was most troubling,missing tile,a pile of filth swept up but not picked up for two day's. We had lunch in the atrium the first day,drinking glass dirty,table top black with ground in dirt ,I wiped it and my hand was as black as the excellent waiter that served us.Hot tub dirty and chairs need to be replaced.your employees are excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, fixtures.  Restaurant area disgusting
review.locationRemarks: Airport  great restaurant across the street( American grill) family dining we ate a combined 15 meals there flawless food and service

The wine lounge has some nice wines and the sports bar isn't too bad for food, but it wasn't anything spectacular.  Was across from the Tesla showroom, which was cool and could smell the It's-It's at the nearby factory at night.

Overall it was a pleasant experience, arrived fairly late, got dinner and went to bed and left early in the morning so we didn't experience everything.

review.title: Location ok
