review.reviewText: We got upgraded to a bigger room- looked like the room hadn't been used in a time. It was very dusty. Had to tell my wife not to clean the room :-) She didn't like it at all.
review.negativeRemarks: C L E A N - D U S T
review.locationRemarks: good shuttle connection to airport

review.title: Great Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable, near airport has a shuttle but is not terribly expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, has an around the clock shuttle, helpful staff, has its own restaurant and room service.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review! Great to hear you enjoyed your overnight stay with us. I am particularly happy to read your comment about our staff. Your compliment is truly appreciated and we hope to see you come back and see us again!

review.title: Excellent location and super friendly staff
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night, to fly out the next day, and paid for the stay and play package which included the parking.  The valet when we pulled up was so friendly and helpful! And then the staff at the registration desk made sure to give us a quiet room because we had an early flight. The room was clean and quiet, with a little balcony overlooking the atrium. The concierge gave us the rundown on restaurants we could walk to, and we really enjoyed our dinner at Max's,and the next morning, the shuttle was right on time, with a friendly driver, and it was all fantastic!  After our flight back, the shuttle was right there, we called the hotel, and our car was waiting for us, and the valet opened our doors for us with smiles and friendliness.  I highly reccommend!!
review.positiveRemarks: room clean and comfy, friendliest staff ever!! Beautiful atrium, great location! Good parking package

review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean & the beds were very comfortable.  Great location, too!

Great if you want an easy link to the airport.

Frequent and quick transfer.

review.title: Makeover Needed!
review.reviewText: I was surprised to see how desperately the room needed a makeover.  The upholstery on the chair was old and looked dirty and slimey.  The amenities were sparse.  The room just was not inviting.  I have stayed at this hotel before but will not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need to be upgraded.

managementResponses.response: Dear Guest, thank you for your feedback. It is our standard to remove all unfinished bath amenities after guest departs. I appreciate you brought this issue to our attention and I will make sure to share your comment with my Executive Housekeeper for review. I can assure you this single incident does not reflect the normal Hyatt standard of quality service and product. We are truly sorry for the poor experience you had and hope you'll reconsider Hyatt for your stay in the future.

review.title: Disappointing stay
review.reviewText: When we checked in the hotel, there was a long line up. We waited for over half an hour before we were able to obtain a room key. The room was OK. But bathroom had molds around the corner of the bathtub. Guest amenities were few - shower cap was not provided. The body lotion was half full and appeared to have been recycled for use from the previous guest. These hotel amenities were meant to be for personal hygiene and use, and it was unacceptable to reuse these amenities. This stay definitely have affected our future decision to stay at Hyatt Regency again.

review.title: Review of Nikko Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall our experience of the hotel was above average. The negative comment is: the daily extra charge for the use of the swimming pool and health club. I don't recall receiving extra charges for these amenities anywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce the daily fees for use of amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from BART, near the shopping center and walking distance to China Town and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Better than avg facility, nothing inexpensive if nice in san fran

review.title: So nice to me!
review.reviewText: Very happy with the experience--did not realize that there was a bird sanctuary trail across the road and how fun it was to see the planes landing.  Very convenient for my purposes, much more so than staying downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very kind and helpful, and at one point offered special consideration b/c I was in town to attend a funeral.  So nice!

review.title: Consistently well maintained SF airport hotel
review.reviewText:
This Hyatt is very reliable.  Clean, well-maintained rooms.  Reception and guest service staff responsive and efficient.  Extended check out time and parking facilities with no trouble.  Got an upgrade to larger room without asking.

Biggest negative is quality of food outlets, which has deteriorated from a previous higher standard.  Menu offerings in the restaurant/cafe are somewhat limited and food is very average; not 4 star.  Menu in sports bar even more limited (less than 12 items on offer over the weekend) and even less appetizing.
review.negativeRemarks: Food services/outlets; currently limited and mediocre

review.title: Well appointed and very comfortable

2 restaurants, pool, & gym offered on the property, so I no need to leave the premises.
Best of all was the room I had was interior to the hotel with a view of the atrium. No external noise which can really be an issue in the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Interior Room.. Room comfort.. Staff was very accommodating
review.negativeRemarks: One set of elevators made for a long...... walk to my room. In all fairness I did ask for the quietest room available.

review.title: Waiting on a plane
review.reviewText: Stayed overnight to catch an early flight to Chicago.  Great room, nice bar/restaraunt, easy shuttle to the airport.
Not all the elevators were operational so there were long waits. Soda machine was out of EVERY brand and flavor. Card key wouldn't work for parking garage even after they re-programmed it twice!

review.title: Beds were too small.
review.reviewText: We had booked for 3 people. There is no way 3 people could have for on 2 full size beds. My son had to go to my daughters apartment to sleep.

I was there for post and pre flight overnight flights. This location has everything under one roof. Extremely convenient. No need to go else where for meals , unless you want to. Staff was very helpful and informative. No place is perfect but I would rate this a 4.5 out of 5.

review.title: Too many problems with Hotel systems.
review.reviewText:
After late evening arrival and check-in, room key card would not operate self-park gate and I had to take $24 overnight ticket to park vehicle. Upon arriving at room the room key card would not unlock the door. I went back downstairs waited in long line to have room key card 
re-programmed. Card still would not operate room door. Waited additional 20 minutes for technician to arrive and repair door lock. Later in evening found that room phone was not operating.
Hotel management credited my account for $24 parking fee for inconvenience.

I had a nice stay at the Hyatt Regency.  Its a beautiful property.  A very large hotel. The pool was much smaller than it looked in the photos.  When I stayed there a large convention of child dancers was going on which made it a very busy and noisy place.  The hotel is so large there is a lot of walking to your room, to the pool, to the front desk so give youself extra time. Also the elevators are slow.

review.title: Convenient, near hwy 101and SFO.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The accommodations are clean and comfortable. My only complaint is the limited number of elevator locations, makes for long walks down the hallways to and from the room.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator location
review.locationRemarks: SFO is the primary reason to stay here. Yoga and good restaurants nearby as well

review.title: Poorly designed & managed
review.reviewText: One bank of elevators coupled with a three day event, constant noise/music, and outdated areas added up to a very poor stay. Wasted time daily.

review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in room

review.title: Standard Airport Hotel in Need of Some Upgrades

Generally what you would expect from an airport hotel of this brand.  However, the hotel is beginning to feel a little dated (I have stayed here often over the last 20 years).  Also, one big negative.....the gym is very, very small.  I like to work out in the early morning and both mornings all three running machines were occupied. Little other equipment.  Having said this, the run along the water is very nice. Service was always very good.   

One other note -- I do not think that the shuttle drivers are the hotels -- but, on both trips to and from the airport the drivers were very rude to passengers.  I am not sure why.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the size of the gym.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing is near by.  This is a bring your own or else order room service sort of a place.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was amazing and very helpful.  The parking rate is absolutely ridiculous.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and cleanliness of room.

review.title: Convenient, so close to the airport.

Thank you.

review.reviewText: This property has been around for at least 30 years.  I grew up in Burlingame and remember its construction when all of the other Airport Hotels were built.  It's still a great property.  Very clean rooms and my TV worked, which is something I can't say for the last three name brand hotel chains I've stayed at.  Very close walking distance to Max's Opera Cafe if you enjoy a fine deli.

The hotel was perfect for a one night stop over onto a International flight. 

I stopped into the Pub within the hotel , the staff was great but the food was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: They have a shuttle into Burlingame town center if you need to do some shopping or eat somewhere else.

review.title: I really enjoyed the location.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located just  few miles from San Fransisco and next to the airport, the hotel is nice and I really 
liked the free parking.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is reasonably priced and very close to the airport.  They also have a free shuttle to the airport which runs every 15 minutes.
However, our waiter for the brunch in the morning (Drew) was useless.  He forgot about everything we ordered (and it was a buffet!).  His "assistant" did all the work and because we were more than 6 people, an 18% gratuity was automatically added to our bill.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Tom,
I am sorry to hear you did not get a peaceful night's sleep. Although we are 1 1/2 miles from the SFO airport, we typically receive comments about how surprisingly quiet the rooms are. Clearly not the case with your visit, but would love to have the opportunity to welcome you back under more relaxing circumstances.

review.title: Light sleepers beware
review.reviewText: I was repeatedly awoken by traffic noise, aircraft takeoffs, neighbors taking showers, and other patron's doors slamming (this seems to be the fault of the door-closure mechanism on every door). The fact that the windows were not double-glazed in a hotel sits a couple miles from SFO is simply unacceptable for a 4-star hotel. I suspect that this building was once a much cheaper hotel, given the above issues, and the fact that close inspection of the fixtures reveals a bit of flimsiness. If you must stay here, get an interior-facing room or a set of earplugs.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows on rooms facing SFO.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Segundo!

review.title: Rude staff and renovation starting at 8am
review.reviewText: Renovation started at 8am.  And it was very annoying.  I called front desk - the lady said you can hear it anywhere.  I told her I checked in midnight and most likely will leave hotel 10am - only 10 hours for paying $200.  Is it possible they resume renovation/construction later in the morning.  She said no!
the area and the hotel common facilities need some renovation

review.title: not a good pace to stay
review.reviewText:
for the amount of money you pay to stay here you don't get much beyond a room. When other less expensive hotels [holiday inn express and best western ] to name a few are offering a free breakfast bar this hotel hits you up for 25.00 per person. you can't even get a free cup of coffee in the lobby. three dollars here.
food cost did not match quality of food in the sports bar. servers in knuckles very rude acted like they could care less if you got your meal or not.
Ifyou stay here eat at the resturant across the street better food at a better price
review.negativeRemarks: lower prices on food
review.locationRemarks: only stayed one night

review.reviewText: the place was nice clean lots of room but the elevators are a little slow and the soda machine was empty
review.negativeRemarks: a 24 hour place to eat in the hotel that has low price
review.locationRemarks: nothing in walking distance from the hotel

review.reviewText: We stayed two nights. Good stay and not noisy. Rooms were large and comfortable. Very close to airport with shuttle service. Good value for the money.

review.title: Looks great in pictures but not well run and noisy
review.reviewText: Got a room facing the highway and found it noisy enough to disturb my sleep. Rooms are fairly dim and feel old. Most alarming is that the parking garage smelt like urine. Really not worth the price and taints the Hyatt brand.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport. Mainly why I chose it as I wanted to be close to the airport for my early morning flight on this 4 night trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade your TVs to digital cable or satellite. Analog blur vision TV is not acceptable at this price. Better soundproof rooms. Better room lights!
review.locationRemarks: Nothing is nearby except for the airport. Don't stay here unless you need the convenience or security of being within 10mins of the airport.

review.reviewText: Our plane was delayed and we arrived at 3:00 am. They extended out check out to let us sleep longer.

review.title: Nice hotel, loud street noise
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very nice. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are great. However, there was a lot of street noise (my room was facing the bay) and there was also a convention in the lobby with loud music playing pretty late into the night. Earplugs were definitely needed. Otherwise, great place to stay.

review.title: Hyatt, San Francisco, Airport
review.reviewText:
Mixed experience:
Requested King Bed, had only double beds, then they gave a Queen bed.
No free Wifi in this age of wireless
Water bottle at $4.00!
Parking $24 per day!
Breakfast not included.
So better to look for a package with all this if you are traveling with family else it will work out too expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near to airport and easy drive to downtown or other parts of silicon valley
review.negativeRemarks: Provide Free Wifi and some free water. That is not asking much.
review.locationRemarks: No major public transport. Nearest good place to eat is Burlingame downtown.

review.title: Good hotel near SFO airport
review.reviewText:
Spent one night here as was catching an early morning flight across country. Check in was very smooth and our room was 'upgraded' as they did not have too many guests, a nice touch. They run a regular complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport - just let the driver know which airline and you'll be there in around 8-15 mins. Check out was very rapid. 

Only MAJOR disappointment was no free internet!!! I have stayed in some incredible and incredibly horrific hotels before which all provide a free internet - a hotel that doesn't provide free internet in 2014 really needs to look at changing policy, especially a huge brand name such as Hyatt. Very frustrating.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to SFO airport. Clean and comfy room.
review.negativeRemarks: Only MAJOR disappointment was no free internet!!!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review and rate us - hope to see you back soon!

review.reviewText:
I needed a hotel close to the airport, and this one turned out to have wonderful facilities and rooms as well as friendly and very effective personnel.
I used their shuttle service to get there, and also to go to the airport to catch BART to the city. The hotel itself is rather isolated, but if you have a car this will be a great location from where to reach San Francisco, the East Bay and the Peninsula.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Kelli!

review.title: Conveniently located and kid friendly.
review.reviewText: Traveled with 2 toddlers and the staff were all very friendly and accommodating, food was delicious with a large variety. Definitely will be starting here again.

expensive, we had a $99 special  rate for one night. Valet parking was $28 a day and Self Park was $24 a day.  breakfast was very expensive to $15 a person and up.   I should've read everything that was included and not included with that rate.

review.title: Nice hotel - close to airport.
review.reviewText: This Hyatt is tired - rooms, towels, etc. just all look very tired. Disappointing for a Hyatt.

review.title: Not as nice as expected
review.reviewText: The room was a little run down. The price was very good and for that reason only I would recommend. The staff was nice and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms run down and smelled musty
review.locationRemarks: A little far from things, you have to drive but that was fine

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: I was stuck @ SFO and this was a great place to be.  Staff provided toiletries as my bags were elsewhere over the Pacific . Had dinner at the restaurant. Shuttle was ontime and easy to get back for my early morning flight out.

review.title: Great hotel near SFO and Burlingame/San Mateo
review.reviewText: When you hard at work on the road, this is a great hotel that is comfortable, and will allow you to get the rest you need to be productive. The rooms are nice, food is good, gym and the outdoor pool are great to catch a moment to restore yourself before you head out for that business dinner or your morning meeting.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hyatt is always consistent. Flawless service, quality product, rooms that are restful for sleeping, and designed so you can be productive.

review.title: Not as nice as you'd expect
review.reviewText: The hotel was mostly fine, but had a couple problems.  The worst was that my tub had lots of short and long hairs in it as if it hadn't been cleaned well.  The lobby elevator bank had some buttons covered in blue duct tape without even a "Pardon our Progress" sign.  No luggage stand in the room.  I was told the hotel shuttle didn't require a reservation, but when I went to catch it, they said it was full, and I had to get a cab.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and lobby were generally very nice.

review.title: World Series Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and check in was a breeze.  If you don't need to be in the city, this place has many amenities and dining options nearby.  Its a $60 cab ride to AT&T Park
Over all excellent a little dissoppiented we couldn't check in a little bit early.Bar wasn't open had to leave to another bar.
my reservation is delurex room and high floor however they gave me a regular room and lower floor. very disappointed

review.title: Very close to airport
review.reviewText:
The staff was very accommodating,  we arrived very late and they offered to waive our parking fee.  
Only complaint would be the hotel is a bit confusing,  nor enough signs to direct you to front desk and check in from parking lot.

review.title: Great location for the airport.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. Staff was very friendly, and the valet workers gave great directions for shopping and eating. I will stay here every time we are visiting the bay area. Thanks again

review.title: Simply terrible
review.reviewText: The restaurant was not up to par. We fled the hotel for a better restaurant, then fled for another hotel

review.title: Not what i hoped for
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very lovely however the hotel itself is old and a little rundown

review.title: Great hotel in an excellent location.
review.reviewText: I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant experience. My family and I have been guests here before but this stay exceeded our expectations. I cannot speak highly enough of the front desk associate who checked us in, Diego. The process ran very smoothly and he took the time to inquire about any further accommodations that could be met. The room was quite nice and I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort of the bed. In fact, I haven't slept that well in months! If you're looking for a hotel that is central to most of the Bay Area, do not hesitate to book your stay here. Such an ideal location next to the airport and only a 25 minute drive to the city. Thank you to the staff for making this a memorable stay.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay really nice & clean hotel, highly recommended

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: This hotel is about 25 to 35 minutes away from San Francisco's center city, but it's well worth it. We went for my Sister's birthday and the hotel comped our breakfast during our stay. The hotel is very clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff was very nice and helpful, it was located right by the water which had wonderful views. the gym and pool were clean and well kept.
review.negativeRemarks: Queen beds instead of double. The wifi is $10 a day and parking is $24 a day. For an airport hotel it would be nice to at least have free parking.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame is very pretty and has a lot of cafes and restaurants to go to along with a really nic shopping plaza

review.title: Last minute deal near san fran airport
review.reviewText: Most cost effective for an over night stay after missing a flight.  Hotel in good condition: even stood up to the 6.1 NAPA earthquake which was felt on the 8 th floor during stay.  Breakfast buffet was also fresh and better than average. Be sure to try the fruit drink. I had like 4 or 5 refreshing shots. It's a large hotel with a square floor plan.  There appears to be only one elevator site so if you have issues walking be sure to ask for a room close to elevator else add a 10 minute walk to getting to elevator lol. There is a regularly running airport shuttle that takes about 10 minutes to airport.

review.title: Very nice and affordable hotel. Nice attrium !
review.reviewText: What I loved about this hotel is the attrium style lobby. I loved how are room was facing the San Francisco Bay.

review.title: IMPOSSIBLE TO SLEEP IN FOUR PEOPLE IN DOUBLE ROOM
review.reviewText:
We are a family and we  booked a double room (indicated for four guests on your site) but at our arrival in the room we discovered that the two beds were really too little-french size not regular queen size!  
As our sons are 21's and 15's we booked for 4 adults so we remained surprise and disappointed about your unclear description of the rooms!
We pointed out the problem to the front desk but they couldn't solve the problem because the reservation was fully paid to you and they couldn't cancel or refund it without your authorization.
Furthermore  we want to notice you that in the  same area and in the same evening there were other hotels of same level that offered  accommodation more suitable to us and at  a lower rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed sizes.
review.locationRemarks: Good just for Airport

review.title: Dated, but clean, quiet and close to airport.
review.reviewText: I found the rooms dated, but clean. We stayed one night and used the shuttle service available to airport which was fast.

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: Every person we interacted with was extremely polite and helpful. We needed a 'pack-n-play' for our kid and it did take a little while to get to our room but it was delivered along with baby shampoo, lotion, a little rubber ducky, etc. We could not be more pleased.
review.positiveRemarks: All of the staff were helpful, courteous, and it made the brief stay really positive.

review.title: A little bit of tarnish but sturdy.
review.reviewText: Starting to show its age a little bit.  Overall it was ok at best.
review.positiveRemarks: I can't help but be happy with the construction.  We where on the 8th floor for the Napa earthquake. A LOT of sway but when it was over no problems.
review.negativeRemarks: Put a phone book in the room and stop the $24.00 a day charge to park while staying there.
review.locationRemarks: Airport is very close. Pizza my Heart delivered an very good combo.

review.reviewText: great expereince.. The staff was amazingly great and helpful. Will front desk was very great and gave us great advice on our upcoming trip. He deserves a raise. Everyone has great customer service.

review.title: Very nice hotel easy to find and plenty of parking
review.reviewText:
Excellent. Great staff. Nice hotel.
Atrium restaurant very relaxing. food good.
Beds comfortable. Very quiet.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is great value, and easy to access the sfn airport. However, the wifi is extra charge.. Which is not happy. The price should include the room price. Great staff, great stay overall.

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText:
We arrived very late for check-in and we were flying out early the next day. Gordon at the front desk (who was a trainee) did an amazing job of getting us settled in as fast as possible. He made our long day even better. Kudos to him and the front desk staff. 

Room was clean, amenities were great - would stay here again.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText:
We were leaving on a very early flight so booked a hotel very close to airport for our last night. 
Proximity was great as we return our rental car that evening at airport then hopped an easy shuttle back to hotel. Made our departure in the morning very easy. Staff we ran into were nice. Room and common areas very clean. Weird there was only one bank if elevators though. Due to layout of hotel we had quite a long walk from elevator to room with way too much luggage. Okay for us but Someone old or impaired would have struggled.

review.title: 2 rooms for 1 night stay.
review.reviewText: After paying $160 per room I was expecting a hotel in better condition.  The entrance was under construction and confusing.  The center of the hotel was very empty and no free breakfast.  The pool was outdated and small as was the hot tub.  A wedding party was going on at the same time so 1/2 of the pool area was roped off.  It felt strange swimming while a large party was nearby.  The rooms had a very tiny balcony, so small you could not sit.  Beds were ok.  Bathroom had no ventilation fan.  We called for a tooth brush and tooth paste.  The direction says your staff would leave the items at the door.  The idiot knocked twice and we were asleep by the time I got up he was opening the door.  That is unacceptable!
review.positiveRemarks: There were 2 room available for the one night.
review.negativeRemarks: Practically everything!  Elevators were ok.
review.locationRemarks: We drove to San Francisco to spend the evening.  Nothing close by to do.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: . Free courtesy shuttles between airport and hotel very requent and efficient. BART station at  San Francisco Airport provides comfortable transportation into city in around 30 minutes at $17.30 return.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, very clean high floor room overlooking San Francisco Bay. Beautiful atrium for a relaxing  breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Across one fairly quiet road to SanFrancisco Bay. An American Grill restaurant across the road.

review.title: Good Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Only overnighted at this hotel but wished I had time to enjoy the facilities.  Staff wonderful.  The door man actually got me a paper while I waited for the airport shuttle bus!  Nice guy.
Dirty, old, small rooms, long walk from elevator to room.

review.title: Okay, staff need to be organized
review.reviewText:
Rooms are okay, however Internet would not work, spotty. The restaurant for breakfast was an issue, no one cleared tables in time, people started seating themselves as there were tables they could see but no one came to seat them.

You have to wait for a long time for bills or coffee.  For a hyatt this is bad service, rooms are decent and clean though.

review.title: very nice property, excellent guest service .
review.reviewText: Food had hairs and hotel operator was on another planet.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was awesome. The room was amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel operator does not help at all. She is so unproffessional compared with the rest of the staff. Will put you on hold for 14 minutes.many times
review.locationRemarks: The bay, and benihana

review.reviewText: There weren't enough restaurants in the hotel, especially given its location. The lobby area hotels were too expensive. I didn't like the courtyard feel of the hotel and felt boxed in.

review.title: Burlingame Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is not bad but the price doesn't merit what you get. Its a good business hotel but nothing more, San Francisco is about 15 miles away and the dinner  lunch facilities are wanting.
Hotel could use a little refurbishing.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to the freeway and close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to get a coffee if you are and early riser, restaurant facilities are minimal
review.locationRemarks: Just the airport

review.reviewText:
Good location, by the freeway and not too far from San Francisco. 
Hotel is nice by the bay where you can see the runway of the airport.
The room is clean and ok. However, it is less space, and it is not as 4 stars as other Hyatts that I had stayed. The parking is expensive and also there is no free internet.

review.title: Weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
Nice older hotel close to SFO Airport with easy access to downtown by BART.
Clean and comfortable rooms.
Staff very friendly nd helpful

review.title: Convenient to airport. Great shuttle service.
review.reviewText: The only downer was a very long queue at check-in. Staff were friendly. Food and beverage were OK for a short stay. Could improve the wine list.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff on desk. Better wine list at sports bar
review.locationRemarks: There is a walk on the bay but really only there to catch an early flight.

review.reviewText: Has a great view of the water and hotel is nice and quiet. Love the sliding glass door for fresh air if you get tired of the ac. Only down side was a long walk to the room. They should also have better choices for food. Very close to the airport makes it easy to get to and from downtown as well.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: The place looks very nice.   The front door was opened for us, but that is where the friendliness of the staff ended.   Check in was curt, as was any other interactions with staff.   Parking adds $25 to each nights stay and no one explained how it worked, we figured it out but not a pleasant experience.  First night so many meetings meant we had to search and circle to find a place for our paid parking.  Internet was 9.99 a day.  Bottle of water in room was $4.  When we checked out they took the room key cards and charged for the parking, then we find out we can't get out of garage, no one mans the exit booth.   Supposed they could have asked when I checked out.  When I went back, they just said that I shouldn't have returned the key card and was annoyed to provide a solution.   Room was barely cleaned, and all towels weren't refreshed.

review.title: Good value hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: It's close to airport and good for someone that has an early flight since the traffic in SF is busy. It took me almost 45mins from airport to downtown on Friday afternoon ($70 USD for a cab) when I just arrived. On the way back, I decided to stay somewhere close to airport. The room is average but the bell man is very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and free shuttle to airport
review.negativeRemarks:
Cleanliness of the bathroom
Staff for house keeping disturbed me from sleep...
review.locationRemarks: Nothing much but get your luggage sorted before you go to airport.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to airport
review.reviewText: Good for travelers needing a quick commute to airport but long distance to downtown attractions.  $60 taxi fair one way to downtown.

review.title: Airport hotel.
review.reviewText: Arrived late, nice room service breakfast and good shuttle service.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle, clean and quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi. Distance of room from lifts.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Marriott and watch the planes.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: The only issue I had was the cabinets in the bathroom were very difficult to open. I like to put things away and wasn't able to do it in this bathroom.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a very good price. Cant ever go wrong with the Hyatt. It never disappoints.

review.title: Great hotel near airport.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Good restaurants and bars within the hotel.  Clean, open air feel.
review.positiveRemarks:
You really didn't have to leave the Hotel.
You could dine, watch the game at Knuckles sports bar, and have a great time
review.locationRemarks:
Burlingame is a charming little town with great restaurants, bars and shopping.
It is near San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Nice hotel. I would stay again.
review.reviewText:
Spent one night. 
Good experience. 
Hotel is huge.hetting a little old but if you get a good price it's a good choice.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel close to SFO. The place was very clean, I got a large discount for a Sunday night stay so I was happy all in all. Would stay there again,
review.negativeRemarks:
Parking was $24  for one day
Ouch !!
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO Airport,

review.title: Close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: All staff are courteous. Clean room , comfort bedroom  nice view overlooking Bayshore  .

review.title: Hyatt regency
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable but a bit impersonal .
Wasn't aware of parking charge per night until we got there!
review.negativeRemarks: No parking charge
review.locationRemarks: Bit remote

review.reviewText: Hyatt is a big name. However, the quality of this hotel does not match the title. I feel disappointed.

review.title: Sometimes cheaper is not inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: See above review
review.locationRemarks: Near airport and subway station

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
The area is under construction and getting there from 101 off ramp coming from southbound is kinda tricky.
Hotel is within walking distance to other hotels and a few restaurant.
Was upgraded to a larger room due no room avail for what we booked.
For the price we paid it was a good deal. Wished I had free in room wifi.
This is a very big hotel your room could be a long walk from the elevators.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are nice. Close to airport. Free airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive $24 No free in room wifi
review.locationRemarks: Not within walking distance to any shopping.

review.title: Great location, but overpriced + overrated
review.reviewText:
When you pay that price for a room here, and along with the great brand name you have high expectations. I got married in a Hyatt so that's why I chose to stay here rather than anyone else near the airport.

When you pay $270 for a room, you don't expect:

- The fridge is so loud I had to turn it off (bear in mind I can see planes landing outside my window but I can't hear them)
- Iron didn't iron. It was broken.
- My room was next to the vending machines which were so loud I could hear them through the wall
- Charging for everything... WIFI, Water etc. It's just so aggressive especially when I stepped into the in-house sports bar for dinner and could get free WIFI. Small details make an experience and in this respect the hotel really failed.

Bear in mind I had been travelling for 18 hours and not slept a wink.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: This is a pleasant, standard Hyatt which is convenient to the airport and I would likely stay here again, but would request a room that does NOT face the highway, which was a bit noisy. It's a very large hotel so it seems quite possible to avoid the noisier rooms.

review.title: Nice location.  Easy access to airport
review.reviewText: Our stay was short, but was a pleasant stay.  Loved the rooms looking out over the solarium and courtyard downstairs.  Loved the fountains.  Staff friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the set up of the rooms looking down to solarium.  The fountains actually sound relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: Stuffy smells.
review.locationRemarks: Airport access great!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We have no complaints about our stay at this hotel. The atmosphere is amazing. The staff is very friendly and always available for questions. The pool area was perfect, we used one of the cabanas. Our room had a nice view of the planes coming in, and the air conditioning kept the room cool. A continental breakfast would of topped off an excellent night.

review.title: Terrible hotel!Waiter serve suck with bad attitude
review.reviewText: Never live in this hotel!!!Worst hotel ever in US!

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: parking is very convenient but expensive. very good location. hotel is clean. Room is small. restaurant is good. Staff is very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be free for hotel guest
review.locationRemarks: walking on the bay shore in the morning.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: So-So place. Expensive not worth the price. Construction inconvienances.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at $24/night is excessive. Bar pricing is too expensive at $6 for a "well" drink.

review.title: nice hotel,close to airport, free shuttle
review.reviewText: nice hotel,close to airport, free shuttle every 10 mins, I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Small rooms , no Internet, expensive parking , not
review.reviewText:
I booked a two queen bed room , once I got the hotel they told me they only one king bed rooms.
Internet was pricey , swimming pool was out door in a city like San Francisco by the bay. locker room was messy as hell. Elevator will open and close in millli secoind
Front desk staff was un courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: every thing

review.title: A great airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Very friendly staff, right from the moment you step inside, i.e. the Reception to Housekeeping and the Concierge.
The rooms are very comfortable and the free shuttle service is a great bonus. A very pleasant stay and will definitely stay there again when in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The very staff. comfortable room, clean room and Hotel free transfer to airport.
review.locationRemarks: Unfortunately did not take advantage to see sight and this area due to time constraints. Free shuttle provided to the town.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed overnight so I could get a scan at UCSF the next morning.

My boys 17 and 18 traveled with me. The pool/spa/gym eere their favorite things. They were exceptionally clean.

I used the blind hotel purchase on Expedia and feel like I scored. I just wish we could have had time for more relaxing.

review.title: Nice hotel close to traffic.
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice. Rooms on one side of hall have balcony that opens up to nice interior area of hotel. Rooms on the other side face the highway and you can hear the traffic.(White noise machine provided in room.) When we checked in, the shampoo and conditioner bottles were in the shower and were half used and they did not bring new one as requested.(Slight bit of mold in shower.) There are no deadbolts at the top of doors and as we were leaving, the maids started to walk in on someone in a room who didn't hear them or was sleeping until they walked in.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was upgraded to a corner room that was huge without asking. Very nice staff. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient to Airport
review.reviewText: Traditional Hyatt design (ask for outside room, not courtyard), nice selection of restaurants and bars. Wifi was not great in room but was free. Conference facilities were very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location for convenience in and out of San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Better WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Location is out of the way from San Francisco so limited activities in area.

review.title: Over Priced for what you get
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice, I have stayed in better for the price. No WI-FI. You have to pay extra for everything.
After spending high price for the room you would think they would give you free internet...not the case.
You have to pay extra for parking 24 or 28 for valet. No free breakfast. They have decent food but nothing worth
remembering except the high prices. They have pay for Movies in the room if you want to spend double to triple what it cost to rent one at home.
Beds were comfy and the room appeared to be clean.
I guess you pay for the location if you want to be close to the SFO airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to offer free Wi-Fi
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: The shuttle was very convenient. Hotel was nice. Only thing thAt could really use work is the quality of the bar

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: This Hyatt is one of the better ones. Not a place I would pick to stay several days but clean and close to airport for early morning flight.

review.title: COOL.
review.reviewText: Kind, helpful staff, all was very cool.... I was not there long, but made things very easy, including transportation with airport shuttles and helping me get a taxicab. Thanks!

review.title: Nice hotel close to SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and close to SF so it was easy to get into the city. The room was spacious and very clean. The bed was comfortable. The hotel restaurants served good food but were almost always packed. It was hard to get a table even off peak times.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Free shuttle between the hotel and airport. Clean and comfortable. Nice looking hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service was supposed to be every 10 minutes. It was not and when it did arrive, I had to wait for the next one as it was full.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do in the immediate area but you're not far from San Francisco and there is a ton of things to do there.

review.title: Convenient, Great customer service
review.reviewText:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt! Customer service was fabulous and the food was great. I felt very pampered. The only downside was how far my room was from the elevator. It felt like it took 5 minutes to walk there.

Loved the convenient, free shuttle to Burlingame.

review.title: Convenient, Great customer service
review.reviewText:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt! Customer service was fabulous and the food was great. I felt very pampered. The only downside was how far my room was from the elevator. It felt like it took 5 minutes to walk there.

Loved the convenient, free shuttle to Burlingame.

review.title: Spend your money elsewhere.
review.reviewText: The bed sheet was dirty. House keeping came right away and apologized. She Changed it. The bed was terribly uncomfortable. The mattress felt old and too soft. I slept on the floor for 2 days. On Sunday, my husband left to get me a coffee since the little stand was closed due to Mother's Day brunch, and when he returned around 10:00AM, the card would not let him into the parking structure. It had already been disabled. The person at the check out was informed of the situation, and he did not apologize at all. He also raised his voice and repeated himself "Let me help you. Let me help you" as though I were stupid. HIs tone was insulting and condescending. I will never return to this hotel again.

review.title: Terrible Internet, Otherwise fine
review.reviewText: I chose this particular hotel because of its proximity to the airport and ratings on Expedia. The shuttle from the airport was reasonably fast/efficent. This property is the second stop on a shuttle the Hyatt Regency shares with a Marriott nearby. Remember a Hyatt is a conference hotel so make sure you have your walking shoes on. Nothing wrong with that - just saying. The gift shop was closed by 8pm which was crazy for a big hotel with nothing within walking distance. But the killer was the internet. Hello people, this is 2014. Guests want their wireless internet. The manager was very nice and moved me up to the club level where the connectivity was better, but not as good as the Hampton Inn I had just stayed in the night before. Room was clean but a bit beat up. .

review.title: I like this hotel, don't know why, but I like it.
review.reviewText:
This was probably my fifth stay. The hotel is spacious and airy, a bit noisy with the waterfall, but that tends to act as white noise. This trip had a couple of glitches. The night I was there, this large hotel had two restaurants open: the bar restaurant, which is noisy and dark; and the mezzanine restaurant--not the large one, the small one with maybe a dozen tables. I waited for over half an hour for a table. That is ridiculous. The food was good--not great, but definitely edible even though I was cranky after waiting so long. The other glitch was in checking out. I called for a bellman, waited fifteen minutes and finally hauled my collections of bags down to the lobby.
If you are not willing to use the services, when you can get them, the place is a lot of work. It is large. The parking ramp is detached, so it is a short walk between the hotel and the ramp. The distances within the hotel are rather significant for anyone for whom walking is an issue--bring your cane or walker or wheelchair.
And still, the place has a certain glamour and I like it.

review.title: 2 night stay

review.title: Very Satisfied Experience
review.reviewText:
Great and comfrotable hotel. Staff are very kind. I didn't have a toothbrush and the staff gave me one. Parking is $20 a night. No free breakfast. My group and I went to a McDonalds for breakfast. 20 min from Downtown Sam Francisco.

For a 4 star hotel it is very affordable on Expedia. In downtown SF you find a 2 star for the same price or even a more expensive. My group and I decided we'd rather stay out of downtown in a affordable and very comfrotable hotel.

The only complaint: One of our beds had dirty looking sheets. They didn't look as white as they should be and had a stains in them that seemed like they couldn't be washed out. I'm sure the sheets and covers were washed, but they were probably just too old. I didn't notice this until the morning before check out, but the covers and sheets were comfortable.

The hotel's been around since '89 (it actually closed for repairs shortly after its grand opening, I believe) so it's not ultra modern, but it has a classic design that's comfortable. Knuckles is open late so you can always grab a drink when you need one, and their free popcorn and half-slab of ribs are great. The front desk are very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Holiday Inn would have been nicer
review.reviewText: I booked this room through expedia for a good price....however, it turns out that overnight parking is not included in the room price for an additional $20.... unacceptable (strike no. 1). (?)..(strike no. 3) I was then shown to a new room directly above the freeway with the road noise to show for (strike no. 4) (heater was marginal in this one). Being treated like this was an unpleasant experience. The rooms were both bad. I will not book the "Hyatt Regency" again since better rooms can be had for less money at the Holiday Inn or the likes in the same area. I will not recommend this hotel to my friends and write about my story on any review site I can find.
review.negativeRemarks: give expedia customers decent rooms; do not modify heaters in an attempt to save costs

review.title: Great up market hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The size and scale of everything was very impressive. The hotel is designed around a central area consisting of restaurant and function facilities with lots of indoor plants and trees, that you can look down on from the rooms on the inner circle. Everything is of a very high quality but i was disappointed that our deal didnt include breakfast. I was also not able to tell when booking this room, what the bed situation would be. I called the hotel immediately after booking it on Expedia but they were not yet aware of my booking. They promised to take down my details and ensure i was given a room with 2 queen beds, but on arrival they didnt seem to have that information on record. The out door spa requires renovation and is not to the standard of the rest of the hotel. There are a few little tiles missing and paint peeling off the concreted edge. Overall a great experience but in future a cheaper hotel that includes breakfast would suit me better. Still nice to have the free shuttle to get to and from the airport. A very upmarket and relaxing feel to this beautiful hotel.

Food is delicious, waitstaff for room service made me feel as if i were catered to on a Holland America cruise, as well as very courteous valets and front desk staff...The female concierge's attitude was a bit uppity, as if i were fortunate to be speaking to her. For a price under 250.00 per evening, it is definitely worth it, especially having an airport shuttle and being so close to SFO Airport. I would not spend any more than that however without having a better pool access, ( without having to climb down back emergency exit stairs which was hysterical, or worse, walking through the lobby in swim suits and towels), an indoor pool and hot tub, or 24 hr access to good coffee, tea etc. Also, would be even nicer if they had more seating available in the atrium to enjoy the open feel.

review.title: Convenient, clean hotel in San Francisco

We chose to stay here because it was between the city and the Shoreline Amphitheater, and we were not disappointed. The hotel was clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Although the hotel seemed to be very busy (there was a tattoo convention hosted there that weekend), the room was quiet enough that it felt like we were the only people on that floor. There was also a Hertz drop box for our rental car, which was really convenient for our 6 am flight time (we just took the airport shuttle). I really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely book here again.

review.title: Glad it was a special half-price offer
review.reviewText: We stayed here because we had an early flight to check in for, and arrived after a five hour drive from Yosemite. It was a nice comfortable place to rest overnight, however, in terms of room amenities and quality it was no better than a Travelodge or Best Western, so we were very pleased we only paid a Best Western price! Very comfortable bed, clean enough etc but a little shabby round the edges, with an extra $20 to park overnight and $12.95 for 24 hours wifi (for a total of three devices) Other hotel amenities priced outrageously, for example $5 dollars for some Pringles.... We had a good room on the 7th floor overlooking the carparking roof and the highway. Rooms on the other side appear to have windows that overlook the inner Atrium, with the restaurants below, and as such have privacy issues, I would imagine.

review.title: A good stay close to the airport
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel, though a little busy.

We did not drive when we stayed here. The hotels (such as this Hyatt) around the SFO offer constant complimentary shuttles to the SFO where you can take the BART yellow line straight into downtown SF (and of course your terminal at the SFO). The concierge was very good with providing us this information.

As a plus, the Hyatt has a list of complimentary items that you can call the front desk for to make your stay more enjoyable.
We took the street trolley to Burlingame, which has a really small town feel to it. Getting back to the hotel was not as easy, but the trolley is not operated by the Hyatt.

To view the SF Bay you would need to walk across the street and a parking lot

review.title: Recommended with caveat
review.reviewText: Everything was good, from the staff to room, except for my dining experience: there's no good restaurant in here much less fine dining. After a long day in The City our family decided to forgo bustling city restaurants and eat in the hotel. But we found that the only dining facility was "Cascade" in the atrium. The atrium was beautiful but the restaurant wasn't much of a restaurant; very limited menu selection to start with. My medium dry martini, which was fixed by my server, who didn't bother to shake it, was lukewarm. My wife's pasta was dry at the top as if it was under a heat lamp, orders were put randomly without asking who got which, and coffees were cold. Needless to say, having expected a good hearty relaxed dinner experience at the end of the long day, we were very disappointed and I had to complain to the restaurant manager. My recommendation is that you may stay here but eat out. I don't know about breakfast though, which we didn't have.

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: The first night we had an issue with Knuckles Sports Bar (we ordered food to-go and when we got back to the room the order was wrong). We called Knuckles to let them know and although they were willing to replace the order with the correct one they were not going to provide the service of bringing the correct food to our hotel room. We were already in for the night so we called to inform the front desk. They were very accommodating and offered to bring the food to our room. When the food arrived it was presented in such a lovely manner (on a platter with better plates and silverware and glasses of ice water, much better than the styrofoam and plastic you normally get from Knuckles' to-go orders). If that wasn't enough of great customer service...which was much appreciated...when we received our complete bill at the end of our stay the hotel credited the amount we charged from Knuckles. Knowing that the hotel staff went above and beyond to make us happy was very impressive.

review.title: Just a great experience
review.reviewText:
You know a hotel is really good when you try their nearby competitors (in this case the Marriott) and find out that everything is almost exactly the same (e.g. room size, bathroom set-up, staff helpfulness) but different enough to make an enormous difference.

In our case, we went first to the Marriott when our flight was cancelled and were pleased to just have a room. The cost was enormous and the complimentary breakfast got interrupted by them insisting that they never provide such things. I wasted an hour talking to the manager before they finally said they were going to do something for me. In the meantime, my breakfast had gone cold and none of our party enjoyed it.

The Hyatt on the other hand came and gave us a bill during breakfast but nicely explained that the complimentary breakfast gets sorted out when we pay the final bill and possibly will be zero. This was a much better experience - no feeling like we have to start arguing when we are in the middle of breakfast just to keep eating!

The staff were really great and made the trauma of a two day wait for our flight back to London seem a lot less traumatic.

They went out of their way to make sure we had a place to stay even after checking out, and then gave complimentary meals on top. Going over and above is what you'll get from these great people at Hyatt San Francisco airport hotel. Recommend the stay.

review.title: Excellent value-beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hyatt to break up a long international flight. The hotel shuttle picked me up within 5 minutes at the airport and in the morning when I had to return to the airport, the shuttle was running every 6 minutes, All of the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and professional. The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel and the room was quiet and comfortable, After an 11 hour flight I was hoping for a comfortable bed and was not disappointed. I had a good dinner at the sports bar and breakfast in the morning before heading to the airport, food was good and service was excellent. My waitress in the morning was especially personable and professional. This was an amazing hotel for an extremely reasonable price. I will definitely stay here again if the need arises.
