review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because of the Hyatt reputation and the convenience to the airport. We were able to return our rental car in the night before we left and the hotel shuttle picked us up, saving us time. Then the next morning we boarded the shuttle straight to the airport. The shuttle runs to the airport every 10 minutes, making it very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet and convenient to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Drop the internet charge....that's a little steep to connect.

review.title: A beautiful quiet retreat near the airport
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful and the room very comfortable - beautiful facility. The only negatives were that the air conditioner was apparently not working well and did not cool the room enough. Also, the floor had not been vacuumed well and there were toenail clippings and other debris on the floor. The rest of the room was very clean. We would definitely return as it was, overall a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the beauty of the facility and the quietness of the room. Never heard an airplane or any other guests. The bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: A little more attention to the housekeeping. Even though we had the air turned down to 67F it never really cooled off to a comfortable temp
review.locationRemarks: We needed a nice place close to the airport and to recover from a very busy trip before returning home. This was a great place to retreat.

review.title: Quick Overnight
review.reviewText: Quick overnight before early flight. Nice upgrade to twin double. Friendly, clean, quiet, convenient.

review.title: Excellent hotel, if a little soulless
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel - clean, comfortable, efficient, and with lots of amenities. It is, however, aimed squarely at people using the nearby airport, and has little charm or character. The hotel would be absolutely perfect for a one-night stop-over if it had better wi-fi services.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to San Francisco airport, and ideal for early connections.
review.negativeRemarks: The wi-fi internet services.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is about 10 miles from downtown San Francisco, and is located to be convenient for the airport.

review.title: wonderful,good airport shuttle,
review.reviewText: comfort,clean,nice,friendly stuff,give me the free wifi code. I have a flight at 7am,i think it is the best hotel to stay,they have 24hours shuttle,and it is so quick and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: cheaper food
review.locationRemarks: there is a pizza restaurant outside, that is cheaper

review.title: Weekend gettaway
review.reviewText:
Staff did not greet me making me feel specially welcome or showed gratitude for my business.
Did not show even a map of the hotel and what was available to see and do within the hotel or outside of it.
review.negativeRemarks: Sweep the floors in the bathrooms. Add plastic bags to all trash cans
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great stay before our early flight out of SFO. We used th pool and ate dinner, relaxed and enjoyed ourselves. The hotel staff was great and made sure everything was perfect.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, although I thought it would be closer to the airport

review.title: a NOON checkout makes a late night arrival perfect
review.reviewText: I arrived late a SFO - Shuttled over to the Hyatt. They checked me in quickly and when I asked to be close to the elevators, they switched my room in seconds!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location - everything is easily accessible!

review.title: Vacation June, 2013
review.reviewText: This hotel is hard to beat, it is beautiful and very close to the airport. A friend and I stayed overnight after spending a week touring the California coast. We picked it because the price was resonable (for California) and we were flying home the next day so wanted to be close to the airport. The beds and pillows are the most comfortable I have ever had at a hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great breakfast at Joe's cafe just down the street and a Shell gas station on the corner so made it easy to fill the rent car before returning it.

review.title: Nothing wrong with this hotel
review.reviewText:
The good - we accidentally clicked the wrong date on Expedia and the hotel changed the dates for us.

The bad - There was nothing really "wrong" with this hotel except that everything is expensive and it is really only just an average quality. I usually stay in mid-price hotels where breakfast is included and wi-fi is included. This very nice hotel makes you pay extra for wi-fi (unless you sign up for something), there's no breakfast or even continental breakfast, and we paid $8 for a piece of cheesecake! There were dirty dishes in the hallway from someone's room service, and they were there all afternoon and evening. We asked for a complimentary corkscrew, which is one of the items listed as something they'll deliver to your room, but it took forever for it to get there. So.... next time, I'll stay at the cheaper hotel down the street where I know what I'm getting for my money.
review.negativeRemarks: Better cleaning crew.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport.

review.title: experience was perfect for a place so close to SFO
review.reviewText: In one word Great! We caught a very early flight out of SFO so it was nice to stay in such a lovely place before flying to Italy.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to SFO and is just a beautiful place with so many amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: n/a

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: Nice atmosphere, clean and quiet. Shuttle service to the airport was quick and convenient.

review.title: park & fly
review.reviewText: everyone was very courteous and very helpful with park & fly accommodations
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to

review.title: Close to airport for an early am flight
review.reviewText: No extras, everything costs from the $4 water, to the internet, to the room service (very expensive compared to the 7 other hotels we stayed in on this trip) etc. No extras anywhere. However it was a quick and efficient shuttle from airport and across the street from our rental car. Clean, large and the pool is hidden way back behind the conference rooms. So although nice I could only give it a 4.

review.title: ideal for disabled users close to SF airport
review.reviewText: Large hotel staying in a room overlooking a covered artrium making it very quite despite closeness to highway & airport. SF airport & car rental centre no more than 10- 15 minutes drive away & simple to get to. Unlike most of slightly more upmarket/business hotels WiFi is free as is disabled parking ($10 for everyone else). Ideal hotel for ending holiday. Staff helpful and obliging.
review.positiveRemarks: free parking for disabled users (only) in a large quite hotel
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast options limited - could do with offering a continental breakfast as well as standard American fare

review.title: So so...
review.reviewText:
The Hotel's staff are very nice and accommodating, except the cleaners. The side table was sticky with something and dusty and the tub dirty. I left a note for the maid but she didn't clean the side table, only the tub.

Overall, the hotel need some upgrade and it appears that no one really care to maintain the rooms. It would only take a few things to make the room look fresh like fixing chipped door, fresh coat of paint maybe.

The food prices are astronomical I think. Due to the location of this hotel, it's pretty hard to go out and find a restaurant nearby so one is stuck with the hotel food. I mean a cup of coffee is $4.00 and a small bowl of oatmeal is $10. No wifi anywhere. Even in the conference rooms or dining. A fellow conference attendee paid for wifi in her room but she can't access wifi anywhere else. So she was only able to use it late at night when we get back to our rooms after conference. Dumb. Funny, the hotel sends out ONLINE CHECK IN and ONLY CHECK OUT NOTICES, but hey, we couldn't do it because there's no wifi anywhere. Yes there are "business centers" where a complimentary 30 minutes of wifi but why would anyone use a public computer when they are equip with ipads, and laptops.

review.title: We always enjoy our stay here.
review.reviewText: The staff are always so nice and helpful. The pool area is very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: It is clean and off the beaten path.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is only 15 min. away

review.title: clean
review.reviewText: very comfortable,but a little expensive,anyway,the service is pretty good and the free shuttle is nice,too.

review.title: near the airport
review.reviewText: we came in late, the room was nice. we called maint. because the refrigerator was making noises. we must of done something, because the t.v. had no signal. we called again an waited over 1/2 hour before someone called to ask if we needed help with the t.v., it was already 1:30 in the morning. when we checked in, we were ask if we needed a wake up call, we said 8am. 8am came and went without a wake up call. this is disappointing from a hyatt.

review.title: Great hotel for commuters or business travelers
review.reviewText: I think this is a great place to stay if you're in San Fran or the surrounding areas on business. I was a little surprised (albeit annoyed) that the bedding doesn't consist of an actual comforter. It was not something I am accustomed to. The free shuttle was a nice thing to have...the concierge told us to catch it to the international terminal at the airport, which has a BART station. We were able to easily commute that way, without worrying about renting a car for our 36 hours stay. Overall, a really nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, spacious, and interesting. Like the atrium feature. Also love that you can "borrow" chargers and things if you've forgotten them
review.negativeRemarks: No comforters on beds.
review.locationRemarks: Business/Airport area

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Would liked to have the restaurant and bar stay open late for those with jet Lang adjusting to mew time zones in this case midnight snack and drink flew in from Hawaii
review.negativeRemarks: Not much to catched up with sleep
review.locationRemarks: Connivance to airport and city of San Francisco

review.title: Beautiful Hotel for family and couples
review.reviewText: I loved staying in this hotel. Has a very nice view from the inside and outside. The dining area is very nice and attracting. The only downside was that in my room, there was two water bottles sitting on the desk. I thought it was complimentary water for the guest. I was so tried and thirsty when I got into my room, I didn't even looked at what it said on the paper on top of the bottle. I drank it and the next day I realized the other water bottle said "water bottle $4". Since than, I was afraid to use anything else in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Charged for water bottle left in the room
review.locationRemarks: great location but far from everything in SF

review.title: Not a hotel for families or older couples.
review.reviewText:
The radio alarm went off at 3:00 AM even though we had not set it. It went off again after a member of the staff had "fixed" it.

No restaurant to eat ordinary food at 3:00 pm other than a burger place, and the breakfast was absurdly expensive, the service slow. Very confusing to what was being served. I was very disappointed, considering the cost. We would have done better at a Holiday Inn!
review.negativeRemarks: Confusing eating places at such a large hotel, with very little choice availability. Not a hotel for families.
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine, although I would have preferred water view instead of foyer.

review.title: great hotel to stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean and it doesn't look old and dingy. Parking was not.expensive at Ll. We paid $10. The breakfast/brunch buffet was a bit expensive. We paid $100 for two people. I think the cost is not worth it. Otherwise everything else was great.

review.title: VERY NICE and CONVENIENT
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel... we got an excellent rate... the room was extremely nice and comfortable... we had free wifi... and the atrium lobby was beautiful... and very close to the airport... the only issue was that we were not told of the $20 parking fee for the garage until checkout... I understand the fee at a downtown hotel, but not for one at the airport...
review.positiveRemarks: very nice, very clean, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: the $20 parking fee
review.locationRemarks: very convenient to highway and airport

review.title: Good for the night before the flight
review.reviewText: Some amenities seemed to be suspiciously out of order during the memorial day weekend I stayed there. I had forgotten to bring my phone charger, and, as the hotel advertised in the room, if I forgot a charger just ask, I did so, front desk directed me to a kiosk which wasn't where they said it would be, when I asked staff, I was directed (because I was told to look for a "pavilion" ) to the pool, and finally, after someone tried to walk me there, found out that it was "out for repair". I still have issues with the Knuckles sports bar there,,,,service is generally slow...Food choices are limited, and thus a bit high in their pricing. But the rooms themselves were nice and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices for food.
review.locationRemarks: On the San Francisco Bay just south of the airport.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: Everything was just great, the service particularly in the Club room on the 9th Floor was excellent. Mimi and the staff went way beyond andeveryone in the Landmark group appreciated the service.

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: only drawback was clerk who thought it a bother to wait on us and a crusty bartender who seemed inordinately curt. other than those two, though, everybody else was most cordial and conditions perfect.

review.title: Very nice hotel, close to SFO
review.reviewText: One small goof. We reserved two rooms, when we opened the door to the first one, the bed covers were pulled back and there was a folder from a conference there. There was no luggage or other sign of occupancy. I'm guessing the last guest came back to the room after room service and took a nap? We called the desk and they brought a key to another room immediately and all was good. Other than that, a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to SFO. Always enjoy staying here.
review.locationRemarks: As stated, this is close to SFO.

review.title: Ok at best
review.reviewText: It has an atrium and the sounds carries. It gets very noisy in the hotel early in the am due to the conference business. The Sunday morning session began at 8am - too much noise on a Sunday. They also feature a Jazz Brunch on Sunday and you could hear the music - not restful stay. Also the rooms are very far from the elevator -- it was a long, long walk to the room.

review.title: Internet sucks
review.reviewText: Everything is good except the wireless Internet cost money and absolutely useless

review.title: Location perfect for pickup to and from the city
review.reviewText: Housekeeping did a great job of getting my suite pressed on Sunday....
review.positiveRemarks: Nukkles Sports Bar and Grill inside the Hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water pressure and Sleep mode on T.V.
review.locationRemarks: Movie Theater near hotel, ease of access to and from freeway

review.title: SF Hyatt Regency
review.reviewText: It was my last day in the US and my dad surprised me with a bay view room. The friendly and courteous staff hooked me up with free wi-fi and the room was great (best we stayed in all holiday), and the shuttle bus was an added bonus

review.title: A great hotel stay.
review.reviewText: A great hotel interaction from reservation to stay. A good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Great hotel to relax
review.reviewText: The staff was very kind and attentive. Very genuine and professional folks.
review.negativeRemarks: Other guest
review.locationRemarks: very adequate

review.title: Nice to be so close to the airport
review.reviewText: The were redoing the pool, the fumes inside the gym were horrible, had to leave.
review.negativeRemarks: Very difficult to find your room, very far from the elevator. Any older person would find it very long of a walk.
review.locationRemarks: close to burnlingame where my friends were and close to the airport.

review.title: Seattle. CDS
review.reviewText: All the staff at this hotel was so kind and friendly.

review.title: Clean, Updated
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel near the Airport. It's completely renovated and has a very nice Terrace with trees where you can enjoy a Breakfast Buffet and there is some nice background music . This is a very Large Hotel, so you can easily get confused where to go.
It has a covered parking garage, and the fee is $25 per night + Tax.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient near the airport if you dont want to drive to Downtown.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Great overnight stay for airport access. Ate at Max's over the road - great value food, good selection.
review.positiveRemarks: Access to hotel. Walk sling the Bay Area. Swim and hot tub outside.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise of hwy.

review.title: Nice getaway
review.reviewText: We would stay there again. Definitely has the feel of a nice hotel when you walk into the lobby and into the room. No complaints!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. The only negative is that the hotel only has one elevator bank. Our room was quite a ways from the elevators. For us it was fine, however if you have difficulty walking you would want to request a room within close proximity of the elevator.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel to stay near the airport. If you drive, just park valet, it only cost $5 more ($25) but you get much nicer respond from the guys and don't have to deal with parking, rain, cold, etc. They do charge for everything from internet, parking, water, etc.

review.title: Only in a pinch
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and dated. The tv did not work for several hours. Automated check-out did not work. Noise from surrounding area was drowned out only by approaching airplanes. Shuttle from airport was late and slow.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service was ok, but overpriced

review.title: Not a good value.
review.reviewText: Just OK. You can do better for an airport hotel. Dated design, no bay view, crowded, weak restaurants. Not a good value.

review.title: hotel with updated rooms with views of the bay
review.reviewText: A pleasant stay at a hotel with updated rooms with views of the bay near the SFO airport
review.positiveRemarks: views of the bay, near airport
review.negativeRemarks: Large hotel with only elevators only on one end of hotel; a very small fitness center
review.locationRemarks: near airport

review.title: Very good airport hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice airport hotel. The inner rooms overlook the atrium, which I personally found claustrophobic because there's no view to the outside. The hotel was very accommodating about moving me to an outside room, though.

I would have liked a hot breakfast buffet at 6 am, but was able to get room service which started at 6:30 am.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast starts at 6:30 am, potentially late for airport travelers
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes from SFO by complimentary shuttle

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: For late night arrivals or early morning departures this hotel provides quick access to the airport.

review.title: Convenient Location - Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is approaching 25 years old now, so it's not state-of-the-art, but it's still quite lovely inside with its atrium design. The staff are friendly and Knuckles Bar serves some excellent pub food and decent cocktails. If you have to stay close to the SF Airport, this is the best hotel for the money.
review.locationRemarks: Mid-peninsula and a minute from the airport

review.title: Thumbs up for Knuckles
review.reviewText: Comfortable and great bar at Knuckles. They were friendly and efficient as well as with a great sense of humour.

review.title: Great hotel at the San Francisco airport area
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days, it was great. It's located in a peaceful and quiet neighborhood, which I personally prefer. Less than 5 minutes drive to San Francisco airport and about 15 minutes drive to San Francisco downtown. Even thought it is located in a quiet neighborhood, but it's easy to find food too, just 5 minutes drive.
review.negativeRemarks: The room interior looks a bit too cramped
review.locationRemarks: Less than 5 minutes to SFO airport. About 15 minutes to San Francisco airport. Easy access to freeway (101)

review.title: san fransisco hotel
review.reviewText: staff happy cheerfull loyal and good fun and humour
review.negativeRemarks: nil
review.locationRemarks: close to airport$70 taxi fare and you are in down town san fransisco

review.title: Don't stay here unless you have to...
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a business trip because it is close to the airport and the major freeway into San Francisco. Not worth staying there if you are not in the Hyatt rewards program. They treat you like a second class citizen and overtly treat Hyatt rewards members like they are more deserving. Get ready to pay too much for poor wireless access.

review.title: Goog for overnight.
review.reviewText: Everything met our expectations. We only overnighted to connect to Asia.
review.negativeRemarks: The bath needs a bit of updating.

review.title: Needs help
review.reviewText:
Hotel appears tired. Meal accomodations were lacking. Only place to have dinner was in the bar which was very noisey and appeared unclean. The other dining area was not open the entire time we were there. Went to the counter to purchase some snacks. The staff said they were not open, but would accomodate me if it wasn't something that had to be prepared.
Front desk, shuttle driver and floor staff were cputeous and helpful.
This Hyatt does not keep up with the sister hotels that we have frequented.

review.title: I'd stay here again :)
review.reviewText: Not a bad hotel for the money. We stayed over on New Years Eve. Hotel was quiet. I did not hear any jet noise from SFO at all.

review.title: Wonderful Staff And Hotel!
review.reviewText: I arrive early before the check- in time. Donny at the front desk went above the call of duty and found me a lovely room. My daughter and I were there for 3 nights, the first night a car alarm kept going off, the staff worked very hard to solve this problem. The manager was very generous in compensating us for any lack of sleep. This was my second stay at this Hyatt, I look forward to returning in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, beautiful lobby and great room service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and covienent for family who live nearby to visit.

review.title: Close to SFO but a whole world apart!
review.reviewText: The lobby, closeness to SFO and staff are the best things about this hotel. Our flight was delayed and we were very happy to have a delightful young man on the front desk to check us in very late at night.

review.title: Perfect night's stay
review.reviewText: Perfect night's sleep after a long trip from the East coast. Shuttle picked us up and brought us to the hotel. Staff was kind and helpful, room was clean and comfortable. Located in a hotel zone outside the airport - convenient for our first night's stay. Picked up a rental car the next morning.

review.title: A trip of vacation to SF
review.reviewText: Good experience for such a location and hotel of quality
review.negativeRemarks: Daily supply
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Looks can be deceiving
review.reviewText:
I was very surprised that the hotel rates for Internet ( which no longer a luxury but a nessecity - like electrical power) were very high let alone charge anything as most hotels now do not.
I found the too was not cleaned properly and especially the bathroom. One day I found long black hair on the bathroom floor both my wife and I do not have such hair.
The room had constant noise from the elevators working which kept us up at night.
All other rooms on my floor were getting the newspaper delivered, I had ask for mine every morning. The rates were reasonable but would have gladly paid more for better service.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good and the airport shuttle bus were also good

review.title: Very comfortable but perhaps not for everyone.
review.reviewText: This was a very comfortable hotel to use. The staff were super cooperative and friendly and the hotel was welcoming. But, there is only one bank of elevators and our room was as far from them as you could go. What a hike. Aerobic, so you don't have to use the gym, but taking our lugged down was a hassle. Plus, the Atrium area where the coffee shop is, is poorly designed for anyone handling luggage or having difficulty walking. Stairs everywhere and not much signage for ramps.

review.title: Great hotel for a low weekend price
review.reviewText: We stayed here for one night in December to attend a holiday party in San Bruno. The hotel is very pleasant, actually better than what I expected for what is essentially an airport property. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Owner of business
review.reviewText: Great experience at the hotel but poor experience with Expedia
review.negativeRemarks: Your company
review.locationRemarks: Great to airport

review.title: Great Hotel for Business Trips
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I went on our first out-of-town trip and we chose this hotel. Although i would recommend this hotel more for people who are on a business trip rather than a regular vacation, We absolutely loved the landscape of the inside of this building. We loved the bar they had as well.It was a nice stay and if i ever arrive on a late flight i would most definantly book a night at the Hyatt.

review.title: Dirty dirty dirty...
review.reviewText: I was surprised at how dirty the bathroom was. No apparent fan for removing moisture caused by the shower. Only a vent which had mold all around it. Also, the shower had dirt and mold between the white tiles which looked like they hadn't been even wiped off in months let alone properly cleaned. Looks like they tried to remodel the room but neglected the bathroom. The floor was so dirty that after getting out of the shower and putting on fresh clean white socks i had to change them before putting on my shoes as they were dirty and had hair stuck to them from a short walk around the room. Needless to say I felt disgusted by the room and would have requested a refund and moved to a new hotel had I the time to do so. I am a busy business traveler and usually only am in the hotel to sleep and get ready in the morning and I don't have time for expensive rooms that are not maintained to equally high standards.

review.title: Great hotel for travelers
review.reviewText: Although it was just an overnight stay, because we were traveling back to Texas, we still enjoyed the stay. The shuttle service from the hotel to airport was great and no waiting for long. The hotel employees were friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurants and the conveniency to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to airport.

review.title: Good hotel! Too far from the city!
review.reviewText:
Great experience. The receptionist was very nice and provided us with two days of free breakfast although it wasn't included in the booking.

The only downside was that it is too far from the city. If you are willing to travel everyday and have at least two additional hours for the commute, this is a good place to stay.

You need to also be aware that the above mentioned free breakfast was billed to us. We had to call the reception to get it taken off.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness. Close to the airport. Free shuttle. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Too far from the city.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Exactly what we needed
review.reviewText: The free airport shuffle that runs every 10 minutes got our stay off to a great start. Straight off long-haul flight to a large, comfortable hotel based around an impressive atrium. Friendly staff, easy check-in and check-out
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle bus direct to and from hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airpot

review.title: Neat hotel
review.reviewText: impressive hotel with atrium . very large hotel but long hallways due to design

review.title: free wifi

review.title: Great hotel, great people
review.reviewText: Thanks for your kindly help with my mom aneurysm, she is getting better now, you save her life.

review.title: A paradise in transitsion.
review.reviewText: Would not think you were that close to SFO - it is just down the road and didn't have to get on 101 to get there. Once inside - you were in another place - couldn't hear the outside.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO - but when inside - you feel far away.

review.title: not as good as before
review.reviewText:
bath is not so clean
too old and need to be renovated
the wire of standing lamp was cut off , we can not read on sofa
beakfast is not so good as before
only two resturants
suttle bus driver is not good enought
I used this hotel more than ten times,but this time, a lettle dispointed
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Park'N'Fly is the reason to stay here
review.reviewText:
We requested a smoking room and were told that one would be ready in 30 minutes. We were also told that the desk clerk would bring our keys to the snack bar where we were waiting. After an hour, we went back to the front desk and were told that the room was ready.

The only restaurant in the hotel that is open in the evening is a loud sports bar with burgers, etc. If you want quiet and decent food, you have to drive somewhere.

We used the Park'N'Fly option to leave our car for a week - great benefit.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Far from San Fran
review.reviewText: We stayed there for a conference. Everything is fine about this hotel considering the price you pay, but the location is a bit inconvenient as it is far from the city, There is a free shuttle service to airport and train station though. Also there is nothing around the hotel but Freeways.
review.negativeRemarks: Location

review.title: Good location for airport
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, although impersonal.
First class staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly receptionist who gave us bottles of chilled water as we checked in!
review.negativeRemarks: Missed the turning - not signposted well
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: I liked it
review.reviewText: All the staff treated us as welcome guests wioith nothing being too much trouble for them. I would certainly go there again

review.title: Hyatt without Wifi included
review.reviewText:
I find it appalling that an airport hotel of your standars should charge separately for the use of internet.
It is now a days standard to have wifi acces, as it is essential to be able to connect to internet
when travelling.
review.negativeRemarks: I was very upset to be charged for the use of Wifi, specially when travelling and staying at an airport hotel
review.locationRemarks: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport

review.title: Great hotel for SFO access
review.reviewText: Very nice, attractive hotel convenient to the airport. The area is industrial and unattractive but felt safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was attractive and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Food options were available. Location was very convenient for SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Location is unappealing, so I would recommend this hotel only for access to SFO.
review.locationRemarks: Industrial, unattractive, no activities; convenient to SFO airport.

review.title: Good hotel close to SFO airport
review.reviewText:
Located close to SFO airport, parking in the hotel is not free and
It Cost 20 usd per 24 hours.

review.title: Ideall for an early start from SFO
review.reviewText: We needed a hotel for one night before an early flight out of SFO. The hotel proved ideal for us - it was a 10 minute ride in the courtesy shuttle to the airport (at 4:30 am anyway) and we discovered that we could return our Hertz hire car at the hotel rather than take it back to the airport which was extremely convenient as we had rather alot of luggage. the only negatives were that it was a huge hotel - which isn't really a problem - and the pool was unattended so it wasn't possible to get any service there.

review.title: Better Than Expected!
review.reviewText: Very quiet, effcient check in, courteous staff, clean rooms and very accommodating. Going to use this facility again!
review.negativeRemarks: None, perfect!
review.locationRemarks: Monterey, CA

review.title: Quiet and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: comfortable and easy to rest in. The extra barrier between the beds and the hall made it much quieter.

review.title: Great hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Close to airport and their shuttle runs every 10 minutes.Three very good resturants.Only complaint is I booked about 5 months out a king room but when checking in was told king rooms sold out.Then was given a queen room,nice,but as far as you could get from elevator and its a big hotel with very long hallways.

review.title: Convenient for a night
review.reviewText:
The hotel is huge and was packed with people on conventions. The elevators took ages and we frequently could not get in.
The room is comfortable but a strange layout. The hotel needs updating.
Breakfast was excellent and very good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Long corridors and long waits for elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for airport.

review.title: STAY IN SOUTH S,F.
review.reviewText: STAYED ONLY ONE NIGHT, ALTHOUGH MY WIFE AND I ENJOYED, VIEW, PARKING AND ALL RATINGS ABOVE .ARRAY TO ALL. THANK YOU. DAVE

review.title: Enjoyed the stay.
review.reviewText: My family enjoyed this hotel very much. The pool and Excise room were great. The beds were comfortable. There was no good space for coffee maker. Overall, we love this hotel!!! :)
review.negativeRemarks: I gat the scald to move the coffee maker... :(
review.locationRemarks: It is good place to go to SF.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel, loved the airport shuttle and the trolley to the CalTrain. Had a nice corner room with extra space.

review.title: Very Noisy night
review.reviewText:
A nightmare for all my family because : It's the first time that we had the impression to sleep in a fottball stadium during a match !!!!
Very bad experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise !!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Pretty good hotel environment and hotel room
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel and comfortable hotel room. The corridor is too long for walking to hotel room.
My hotel booking with free valet was confirmed with front desk, but one of valets denied my free valet parking who insisted payment. I had no idea of the parking policy.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking

review.title: Good but not Great
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little dated and could use a face lift. The staff was good except disclosure of holding deposited and charges. The pool and gym is a little small, and the pool wasn't heated as stated in discription. The beds could be more comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Fees
review.locationRemarks: It was ok. I liked Broadway where we ate every day.

review.title: No good enough for the Price and Rate
review.reviewText:
Good: Nice facilities, nice Service, Good location, flexible chekout time.
Bad: Too big Lobby area with no enough sitting areas (just 4 small chairs) to resting while (we have one disable family member)
Expensive Internet acces. (I beliebe that have to be free as Guest service mostly when the location is close to the airport that means too many guest are working while traveling)
No free self Parking. Parking fee $20 daily to close to the Valet fee which was $25
No brekfast included (I believe for the price HAVE TO BE included)
Ice machine toooo far!!! almost 300 ft from my room.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: Much nicer than the boutique hotels downtown and even less expensive.

review.title: Mostly good.
review.reviewText:
Nice room and view of the bay and airport runway, without the usual airport noise. Desk staff were extremely helpful, efficient and courteous. Convenient computer station in the lobby for printing boarding passes (thank you!). The courtesy shuttle to the airport ran regularly and efficiently (thanks, again.)

Limited dining options for Sunday lunch, though. We found the brunch buffet in the atrium at $45 a person (no, thanks). The sports bar was so packed that people were lined out the door and onto the atrium balcony. There is another nicer restaurant in the hotel but it didn't open until dinner. We waited for a while at the sports bar but when the line didn't move, we gave up and left the hotel to dine elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location; friendly, efficient staff; nice room; courtesy shuttle and available boarding pass printing
review.negativeRemarks: dining options on Sunday

review.title: The hotel was great. Littel far from the city
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 night at this hotel, It was nice, clean and comforter bed. Although everthing in the hotel quite expensive but we very enjoyed it.
review.positiveRemarks: my favorite thing about is that the hotle have a great service. Our duaghter got sice one day, the hotel sent her chicken noddle soup up to the room .
review.negativeRemarks: little far and little restaurants around the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: great location if you don't like alot people, easy access to the airport

review.title: Great airport facility.
review.reviewText:
Cell phone and PC charging lockers in the lobby....cool idea! Many hotels on the same street offer free wi-fi and parking. The Hyatt charges for both. They should not!

The 24 hour fitness room was nice to have. I worked out at 3:30 a.m.

review.title: Convenient for airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were a little impersonal. The bathroom was a little drab and the shower didn't work very well. It was noisy and seems fine for business travellers and airline crew.
Was fine for a one night stopover due to free shuttle to airport and a basic breakfast buffet.
Not as good as previous Hyatts I have stayed at.
review.negativeRemarks: Impersonal
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for airport

review.title: A great place to stay on the Peninsula
review.reviewText: In the heart of SFO country, a beautiful property with easy access to the airport, Stanford and the City. I had been hoping to stay there for some time, and am happy to see the affordable rates extended thru Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: the Atribum food and computer resources
review.negativeRemarks: parking rates: $20/day even for motorcycles
review.locationRemarks: near to SFO but not noisy

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Hotel clean, but it would have been nice to have more foo choices.

review.title: Comfortable-pleasant staff
review.reviewText: We booked through expedia and found that the imformation they gave us was not accurate. They told us there were no parking fees-that was one of the reasons we booked here. We hope it is solved after contacting expedia services.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees after we were told there would be none by expedia.
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Comfortable and clean, updated and cool atrium!
review.reviewText: What we liked: clean, updated rooms, curteious staff, interesting atrium architecture and proximity to airport (with shuttle)
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is shaped to accomodate a large atrium with small trees and waterfall where the restaurant is located. It's a little city of a hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff is excellent. They remember your name and frequently address their guests by name. They are cheerful and friendly. The staff at the restaurant (Swiftwater Cafe) is also excellent. They are extremely friendly and welcoming, and the food is delicious!

The hotel is also extremely convenient to getting to and from the hotel. There is a shuttle leaving from the hotel to the airport six times each hour.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the beautiful atrium where the restaurants are located.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: dirty and clogged sink
review.reviewText:
room dirty
tv didn't work
bathroom dirty
bathroom sink did not drain (how is this possible unless cleaning staff don't care - evidenced by condition of room)

all very disappointing for a hotel that serves as a convenient location for busy airport travelers

review.title: Timely airport shuttle.
review.reviewText: After an overnight stay, used this hotel to get to the San Francisco airport very early in the morning. They truly have 24 hour airport shuttle service. Every 10 minutes.

review.title: clean & comfortable
review.reviewText: Very clean, comfortable, and polite staff. Shuttle service from airport was wonderful to and from hotel. Had a great view of the ocean and airport.
review.negativeRemarks: All other hotels had unlimited access to the internet on lobby computers. The first 15 minutes was free and then they charged...didn't like that.

review.title: I'd look somewhere else next time.
review.reviewText: The only things I can complain about with this hotel are the location and the cost. The hotel is located in kind of a sparse area. On top of this, the hotel restaurant options are expensive, the rooms are not inexpensive, and there is no free wi-fi. Also, the TV channel selection left something to be desired. They wanted $4 for a bottle of Aquafina.
review.negativeRemarks: Price, lack of wi-fi, tv channel selection
review.locationRemarks: Sparse

review.title: You could do better
review.reviewText: Hotel OUT OF THE CITY charges $20/nite parking. Though the grand atrium hotel appeared to be half full, our assigned room was the greatest distance possible from the one bank of elevators. Our view was of heating, water, other hotel maintenance equipment, and the freeway, whose various vehicle noises could be heard thoughout the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Distance to elevator
review.locationRemarks: On the freeway, charges for parking, 30 minutes from San Francisco

review.title: Busniess Traveller at SFO
review.reviewText:
Request room on the upper floor to maximize quietness...
If you need breakfast, buffet is very good....order with room at the time of reservation for discount....service is excellent!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice atrium with outdoor being indoors!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking in parking garage will cost you an additional $20/night!
review.locationRemarks: Located near SFO on hotel row...don't expect food accommodations within walking distance.

review.title: Handicapped room needs a little more room.
review.reviewText: We had a handicapped room which was great for me, but the rooms weren't large enough for my husband to maneuver around much. The bathroom was great as well as everythingelse. The staff was great and on top of everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Handicapped room needed more room for a wheelchair to get around.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! We chose it because it was close to the airport.

review.title: Not Again For Me!
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, the cleanliness was ok - not the cleanest I've been in. What was a major disappointment to me was that I felt I was being kicked out of my room before the time I was suppose to be checked out. Housekeeping wouldn't stop bugging and even barging in my room after I told them I would be out at noon which is the standard check out time. I also felt like they were trying to gouge my wallet every chance they got with extra parking charges and having extremely overpriced water in the room as a tease and temptation just so they can get more money! I won't stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of privacy!

review.title: very good, a little costly
review.reviewText: Not enough staff at front desk, waited too long to check in.
review.negativeRemarks: No free parking or internet
review.locationRemarks: Good, very close to airport and highway 101.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Outdated, old and musty room. Interior room noisy and couldn't sleep until almost it finally got quite around 10:00. Had 6:30am flight. It was not a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy and musty
review.locationRemarks: Ok to SFO

review.title: fair at best
review.reviewText: A one-night only stay, but two rooms booked together were located on the same floor but a solid four or five-minute walk apart. ( wierd for our 80-year old traveling companion in the second room). Perfectly OK if totally forgetable hotel, fashionable I'm sure in 1983, and a fair deal when booked at Expedia's rate. But honestly, 4 stars is one too many for this late-night arrival airport layover joint. I suspect that at their standard rates, one could do considerably better.

review.title: Wireless is not free
review.reviewText: Too bad the beds were only full size and not queen. Also too bad you have to pay for a wireless connection. That is pretty cheap as far as I am concerned. Otherwise all was great.

review.title: Disappointed in service
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel was terrible. I had to wait in line to register for at least 15 minutes after arriving at 11:00 AM. Then the next morning I requested a wheelchair for 8:30 AM and it didn't arrive until almost 9:00.

review.title: good for business
review.reviewText: only negative was that parking was $20/day, whereas there are several hotels nearby that have free parking. not really convenient to SF, but close to the airport and a very nice hotel

review.title: Excellent Concierge
review.reviewText: The concierge, Winnie was superb. Her customer service skills are a role model to all. Within 30 minutes, she was able to confirm and perform the necessary preboarding requirements for myself and my children. She assisted in Fed Ex-ing my packages and support me in returning my rental car. I couldnt be more thankful for her assistance.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Beautiful facility, and very clean. Staff was pleasant and eager to please. Stayed in one of the Bay View rooms. Very nice, but mostly a view of the airport. Easy access to Hwy 101. Wireless and parking were separate charges. Parking seemed expensive, but I'm not from CA.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful hotel to stay at, it's a beautiful hotel, the room is nice, clean and comfortable. The location is perfect and close to the airport. One of the drawbacks is parking fees, but parking in this part of the town is expensive to begin with. You have to shell out a Jackson for self-parking, and a little bit more for valet. The self-parking area is very close to the hotel however. The concierge was nice enough to let us park in front of the building for 5 minutes to check in, which is a breeze and takes less than 2 minutes. There are plenty of elevators and fast as well. The room is clean, although fairly small. One complaint that I have is the WI-FI for internet is not free,but I guess the hotel is designed for corporate travelers. We needed the internet connection for just a few minutes and not worth the $10 fee they charge for internet connection. After we checked out, my daughter realized that she had left her iPod on the charging station in the room, but we've calling the hotel for days but to no avail. So I guess the room service workers are not honest at all. It is unfortunate. So please make sure you don't leaving anything in the room here.
review.positiveRemarks: View from balcony onto the lobby
review.negativeRemarks: They charge for parking and WI-FI
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: restaurant from hell
review.reviewText:
Terrible food service-especially Knuckles pub.
Bad food-surly waitstaff=money down a rathole.

review.title: Wonderfu!
review.reviewText: Quick overnight visit to San Francisco. Didn't want to pay high prices for less than a 12 hour stay. We had a late check-in, everything was perfect from the front desk person to the room itself with a view of the beautiful Atrium! I was sure we would be facing the freeway, not so. I am a light sleeper and found the hotel to be very quiet! I would definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious Room!! Parking was reasonable with in and out privileges.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have offered free continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Location was very convenient, off the freeway and minutes from San Francisco

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Overall stay was good. Expedia Room blocks seem to be the farthest away from the elevators and this room was a very long walk away. Good room but the hotel needs more elevators, ask to be close to elevators. Had a conference at hotel and my room was suppose to be a king, they said none were available, so I had double beds. Sink was stopped up on the first day but staff was very quick to correct it and did not have any other issues with room.
review.negativeRemarks: elevators
review.locationRemarks: Good for airport convenience.

review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service is not exclusive to the Hyatt and presents problems when the Marriott customers get picked up first!

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: Airport hotels are generally sad places. This one is not!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Good for San Francisco

review.title: Very large conference / event facility
review.reviewText: Good location, frequent airport shuttle, very large hotel. Rooms to the inside atrium are considered more quiet, however would recommend to outside with view of Bay (away from 101). Parking at the spacious adjacent hotel-owned garage is 20$ per night, with in-out priviledges and up to 5pm of checkout day. Bought this as undisclosed 4* and not disappointed. Pool looked nice but no time to check due to closure from 10pm to 6am.
review.negativeRemarks: cost of parking

review.title: Objects in the mirror...
review.reviewText:
Room Rates on the Internet for this property look attractive, however, you are up charged for everything, wi-fi Internet service is on the top of the list, 15 free minutes in the lobby, then $6.95 for the next 15 minutes! And

So on. We called room service for a pot of coffee in the morning and were told it would be at least an hour wait. They also don't tell you about the parking charge per day, $25. There's more but we haven't got the time.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: It is a beautiful hotel with nice rooms. Staff are helpful, pleasant and professional.

review.title: easy street.
review.reviewText: quick, effortless registration. Room exactly as ordered and accurate self check out with timely shuttle to the airport. Wonderful!

review.title: Beware, they over-charged me for bottled water!
review.reviewText: Check-in was no problem and there is a convenient shuttle from SFO airport, however there was trash from a previous guest in the room, and I was double-charged $8 instead of $4 for the bottle of water we used. I called to have the charge corrected, and they didn't even apologize. Be sure to check your bill! Would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Being double-charged for bottled water.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO airport

review.title: Good airport hotel, clean and surprisingly quiet!
review.reviewText:
Well located and surprisingly quiet for such a big and busy hotel close to the airport.
Airport shuttle was super efficient as well.
Am surprised the buffet breakfast doen't run later than 10am though, especially for an airport hotel. But generally a very pleasant stay.
book in advance for best rates, walkup rates are steep.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast finished too early
review.locationRemarks: 10 mins shuttle ride from the airport

review.title: one night stay
review.reviewText: My daughter and I arrived late on Saturday evening for a one night stay and we were warmly greeted by the concierge staff. They were very pleasant and went out of their way to give my daughter coloring pages and crayons and bottled water. Very pleasant stay. thank you!

review.title: sfotrip
review.reviewText: the only thing that i was dissapointed was that there were no spanish channels on your tv.

review.title: The 8 hour stay.
review.reviewText: Our time was limited - we arrived at midnight and left at 8 AM, so we were not able to check out many of the amenities. The staff was friendly and professional. The wake up call was exactly on time. The room was quite acceptable for its location and price.
review.positiveRemarks: It was located close to the airport, but we didn't here any airplane noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Regular shower only. Would have loved a jacuzzi tub.

review.title: A bit disappointed.
review.reviewText: Furnishing of the hotel is great and everything is clean. However, everything in the hotel costs an arm and a leg, from wifi, to asking for a microwave in your room. Usually most hotels allow free wifi in the lobby, but this one charged even for that. The pool was not closed to the public because there was a conference at the hotel. Overall, we were disappointed with the stay as we were not able to do the things we wanted to do.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi costs money, even in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Good, just not the inner courtyard-facing rooms
review.reviewText: Overall a very good hotel, but don't book a room facing the inner courtyard - there is too much light and noise floating up from meeting rooms, restaurants and the lounge, and the isolation isn't very good - not something for a restful sleep!
review.negativeRemarks: Room facing the inner courtyard - toom much light and noise for a good sleep!
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, a 5-minute drive by the free shuttle bus to the airport.

review.title: Average Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: This is your typical airport hotel. Clean hotel, nice service, but average at best rooms. The beds were very hard and the pillows where flimsy. The room was so hot we could barely sleep, and ended up waking up before our wake-up call. However, if you need a place close to the airport to stay with a shuttle this will work. We had a rental, so we would have in hindsight stayed downtown at one of the boutique hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot, hot, hot room...
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: good business hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel for business traveler who needs to be outside on the city.

review.title: Great Surprise.
review.reviewText: Great stay...even better as a mystery hotel. Takes a while for airport shuttles to show if you just miss them.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText:
carpets were starting to fray at edge of bathroom (room 6121)

The bed was extremely comfortable and the room spotless.

We were treated like royalty and really enjoyed our stay. A perfect end to a lovely Christmas vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: Ensure you get a package with the free breakfast, otherwise it is $25 per person.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing noted
review.locationRemarks: A distance from central San Fransisco, but shuttle takes you to airport & you can catch the BART (train) into the city. Convenient to airport.

review.title: Great stay near SFO
review.reviewText: Very nice.

review.title: Hyatt rates well in our bookings
review.reviewText:
Just what we wanted-clean, convenient, nice amenities........
We would definitely stay again on our next trip through SFO.

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText: We have already gone back. It is a winner.

review.title: Charge of Internet fee
review.reviewText: The reason I gave it a 4 is the charge of Internet fee. $9.99/24hours for a slow speed connection.

review.title: Nice Atrium
review.reviewText: One night stay. There was a tattoo convention going on and it was pretty loud and routy throughout the night.
review.locationRemarks:
Inbound would be downtown. Closer to the action.

Outbound would be by the airport.

review.title: By the bay, but around the way
review.reviewText: I was impressed with service, but the hotel needs an upgrade and didn't live up to the Hyatt standards of luxury that I am familiar with.

review.title: SFO on the Bay
review.reviewText: The Hotel was wonderful and convenient for my travel itinerary.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Clean, quite with easy access to down town SF. Price was very resonable

review.title: Fail
review.reviewText: Every staff member I encountered was new, and knew nothing. The free airport shuttle, ha. Full with everyone from the Marriott and then next two shuttles were "drop offs" only. So they made me 20 minutes late to the airport. Music in the Courtyard at 10am on Sunday morning makes it hard to sleep in. Very disappointed with my stay.

review.title: Hyatt San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Convenient pick-up from Airport with Shuttle available. Hotel comfortable with basic amenities

review.title: Great hotel and location for traveling in and out of SFO
review.reviewText: Need a place to stay before you leave or arrive through SFO? This is it. Clean, stylish, and easy to find.

review.title: Sfo Airport
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with the Hyatt Hotel.

review.title: Nice....
review.reviewText: Great place to stay overnight before an early morning flight. Shuttle service schedule provided at check in made it easy to plan your wake up time. Quiet.

review.title: Great hotel close to airport.
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel on short notice after having to cancel a trip to new York because of hurricane Irene. The hotel was a 5 minute courtesy bus ride from the hotel. It is actually in Burlingame which is actually outside San Francisco The hotel was gorgeous and I would rate it as a 4*+. It had everything you could want except a large choice of restaurants.
If you are planning on travelling into San Francisco it is a $100-$120 round trip by taxi. However you can get the free courtesy bus to the airport where you can catch the BART train to Powell street (Union Square) for approximately $16.20. Much better value for money.
The hotel room was beautiful, clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff were polite and helpful. The food was excellent and the Knuckles bar very good.
Again would rate the hotel 4*+ just missing 5*.

review.title: Modern facility - Comfortable and quiet
review.reviewText:
We stayed here one night. We had driven down from Lake Tahoe and were awaiting a flight out the next day. The room was well laid out, a good size, and every though to the guests comfort was evident. The desk was nice and big with a comfortable chair. The bed was comfortable. Noise from the hall or the atrium didn't filter in.

We slept well and were on our way the next day to Dallas where we got stuck due to hurricane Irene. My wife kept mentioning how much she enjoyed the Hyatt.

review.title: Nickel and Dime You to Death
review.reviewText:
They charged for both the internet and parking. These are unacceptable charges!

Additionally, the room darkening shades were inadequate. If you are a late sleeper or sensative to light take a room on the west side or pass on the hotel.

review.title: Would definately stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was really nice-easy drive to SF downtown. Great room-good service and clean.

review.title: "Excelelnt staff; I would stay again".
review.reviewText: the starf at the Hyatt Regency by SFO were very friendly as well as helpful. Overall I was a very satisfied customer. I would definitely stay again!

review.title: Will use it again. Was wonderful
review.reviewText: Got a great deal for a luxurious room. Too bad you have to pay for parking.

review.title: Best-looking hotel in Burlingame...but w/ one minor setback
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is ideal if you plan on using the BART public transportation system. The Millbrae station is just about 2 miles down the road with an abundance of parking for you to leave your car at while you're in 'Frisco (which most BART stations don't even provide). And it's far enough away from the city, that once you're wore out from the fast-paced lifestyle downtown, you can return to your hotel via BART and enjoy some peace and quiet. The only downfall to our whole time there was...once we arrived and went to check-in, we were informed that the "Bay View" room which we paid extra for was not available because they give first priority to those who book directly through them, and don't use third-party sites, such as Expedia. So instead we settled for a freeway view room and they tried to make it up to us with free parking (normally costing $20/day). It would've been nice if they could have contacted Expedia prior to our arrival and told them to shoot me an e-mail and let me know, so I don't need to find out at the registration desk. But what can you expect?

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Fantastic Hotel ..Nice shuttle service to SFO really clean rooms and nice atmosphere... Slightly slow on check in....

review.title: Just Okay
review.reviewText:
Convenience location, good shuttle service to the airport and surrounding Burlingame area, excellent house keeping staff
No common area for internet -need to pay extra, no in room coffee/tea (consider expensive room charges

review.title: Hope to stay again
review.reviewText: Out of the way, but in some ways that's good. Not too far from the city anyway. Very nice hotel.

review.title: Will try another hotel next time
review.reviewText: Fairly nice hotel but way overpriced for what you get.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved that they have free 24 hr shuttle service to the Airport. Very convienient way to access the bart station if you need to go into the city and you don't have a car. Also very accessible to surrounding restaurants. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the cleaning staff were on top of it. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. We will stay there again.

review.title: Good hotel with a point off
review.reviewText:
Overall very good for everything except that I had a Bayview room on the 5th floor which is actually a parking lot view. There is a commercial building that block the bayview. Also, I am facing a park lot with cars.
One more cons for this hotel is that they just don't give free parking, free internet, free breakfast for their customer. It may be a better idea to like in those smaller motel or inn that provide all these benefits (they mostly have nice rooms!! especially in Millbrae and Burlingame)
But overall, it's a good hotel to stay with.

review.title: Only if the Hotel food is reasonable....
review.reviewText: Good location, service and comfortable room - I would give 100% if they cover the pool and heat the room in cold days (end of June at 62 F) and they provide good and reasonably priced foods... those are the only issues I had. We went to near by restaurant. How many people willing to spend $38 per person for Sunday Branch?

review.title: Nice visit - great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was great and the atrium centered hotel was elegant.

review.title: Worth every penny
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced given the proximaty to downtown SF and specifically the airport. A little more water pressure in the shower would be a huge plus.
Everything was great except the air conditioning.

review.title: Good location, convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Good location and close to the airport. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is an extra charge for parking though, which is a bit annoying. Room was clean. It is exactly what you expect a Hilton would be.

review.title: Nice Stay!
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel at the 'secret' price, we weren't sure which hotel we were getting, but we knew it would be 4 stars.

I've never stayed at a Hyatt, and it really was such a great experience! Everyone was kind and helpful, without a snooty vibe.

But just remember, there is a nightly charge for parking which I wasn't aware of at first, but at the rate we got, it wasn't really much of a problem.

By way of asthetics, this hotel was super pretty! A nice flat screen TV and a desk/chair and the atrium was gorgeous from the 4th floor, so much nicer than staring at a parking lot from your balcony!

Clean: The rooms were clean and lovely, as was the bathroom. The White Ginger shampoo, conditioner, soaps and lotion had me using their samples instead of the ones i brought they smelled so delicious!

We only stayed in our room one night, and spent most of the time in the city, and at the de Young early the next day, but the limited time we were there there was not a problem with noise or weird smells. I just wish we had more time to explore this mamoth hotel!

review.title: Convenent for short business trip.
review.reviewText:
Overall the Hotel was nice, clean and confortable.
Guest parking $20.00 was excessive.

review.title: Sleeps nicely, however....
review.reviewText:
The problem with this hotel is the not the sleeping part, but the food service. Although it lists a few outside the hotel it basically has three food services - a deli type, main restaurant, and a "Historical Sports Bar". The Deli is fine, no problem with that. I would like to be able to eat at the main restaurant, but it wasn't open for dinner on a Sunday evening when I stayed the weekend, nor did it seem to be open for lunch while I was there. Sunday Brunch is great, but Sundays only come once a week. This leaves the "Historical" Sports Bar.
First, "Historical" is not a word. What they mean is "Historic". Second. Service here sucks. No refills on overpriced sodas, they only serve ice tea by the bottle, again, overpriced, and the food is okay at best. Plan to spend at least forty five minutes between walking in and getting food. They are pushing the drinking here, nothing more. I hate having to go to this hotel for this reason alone, because I feel I'm a hostage to being gouged on food prices.

review.title: They need a lesson in ergonomics
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for a conference and the conference facilities were great, but the room was a source of frustration. There was no wall light switch for the main part of the room and the corridor light did not really reach it, so when I first entered I had to stumble around in the dark and feel around for switches on the lights on the night stand. The hot and cold water faucets in the bathroom closed in opposite directions. There was no safe in the room. Probably the worst of all was the refrigerator which turned on and off at frequent intervals and made a noise so loud that even though I am usually a heavy sleeper, I woke up several times during the night when it turned on.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: For a hotel of this rating and cost, I was truly disappointed to have to pay $20 for parking per night as well as for internet service. In addition, my reservation was for 1 king bed and instead I was given two 'pretend' queen beds (really full size, not queen) and the sound from the atrium area is constant, even at night.

review.title: Upscale yet friendly with many ammenities
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to the airport. It offers great restaurants, clean, quiet, comfortable rooms and a friendly staff.

review.title: close to San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel-great location close to airport with free shuttle service. Does not offer free internet service. Also, wake up call was not reliable.

review.title: Be back next confrence
review.reviewText: Extremely polite staff in all departments from housekeeping to restaurant and bar, and of course the front desk. Thanks to everyone for a great stay.

review.title: Great Airport Area Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice room overlooking the atrium area. Very clean and the staff was friendly and very accomodating. Would definetly stay again next time I need a room near SFO airport. Excellent room for the price.

review.title: As expected quality and service, recommended for one nite before flight departure"
review.reviewText: Perfect location if you need a nite hotel before your flight departure, nice atmosphere and good services in general, not many choices to dinner I would say, and the services is just "okay" nothing beyond in the available restaurants, however the room and the facilities are well mainteinned , I would go stay back a night before my back flight

review.title: Nice Hotel, convenient to airport
review.reviewText: This Hyatt is a HUGE hotel. Our room was very clean, was a good size, had nice amenities and was comfortable. It kind-of has a modern touch. Despite it's size, and business, our room was quiet. It is obviously convenient to the airport. We used the shuttle to get there and it was very easy. All of the staff that we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. We stayed here on the last night of our trip to be convenient to the airport with our two teenage daughters and we had plenty of room. I would definitely recommend it. Great price through Expedia too!

review.title: Don't stay here for the atmosphere.
review.reviewText:
This is a large airport hotel. The location is convenient, but there was a very loud convention occurring during my stay, and my room fronted on the internal hallway (open down to the convention floor).

The staff tried hard, but there were always overflowing trash cans in public areas. I tried to avoid walking through the lobby. The rooms were clean, lovely and comfortable once I was inside.

review.title: Not Impressed.
review.reviewText: t is a four stars hotel, but they didn't provide enough bath towels. We also had hard time to exit garage when when we checked out. We paid $20 for overnight parking, The room key is one to be scanned for exiting the garage. It took more than 10 minutes to exit, the error message was key # is not found. I emailed the hotel manager on the second day and have not heard anything back from the hotel.

review.title: not impressed.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and hotel overall did not convey the hyatt spirit and professional attention to details.Only recommended for location.

review.title: SFO Comfort Stop
review.reviewText: My husband is disabled and we arrived VERY jet lagged from Singapore. The staff were courteous, the check-in fast and efficient. My husband's handicap vehicle was destroyed by Singapore Airlines and Hyatt had a wheelchair out to the shuttle and helped my husband get to the room with no delay. I was impressed and so grateful for all of the attention and help. The bell staff even tried to help my husband get his vehicle where it would run. Everyone was extremely nice. Thank you.

review.title: Would go back when in SF.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel with everything you could want for relaxing and your comfort.

review.title: Nice Hotel. Bad Location.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice. However, there are no locations within walking distance, such as bars, restaurants, cafes, and stores.

review.title: Not a 4-star hotel!
review.reviewText: I chose this location to be near the airport for an early morning flight, and it definitely served that purpose. Shuttle service was very convenient and prompt, there was complimentary flight check-in at the front desk. Rooms were surprisingly quiet. It is a huge facility and was sold out which made it seem very crowded. The front desk clerk asked and answered the same questions more than once, which made it seem very impersonal. We did not use other services, but rooms and common areas just seemed very spartan and not typical of other Hyatts I've stayed in.

review.title: it was good for business conforence
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel. We like it.

review.title: A great place for the San Francisco stop-over
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport fit my needs. I found a nice restaurant close by for a leisurely dinner. The room was comfortable and clean. The shuttle to the airport , even in the early morning, was very convenient. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive.

review.title: Ideal for our family trip to San Fran.
review.reviewText: Everything went as planned. Hotel was a very comfortable, friendly & ideal place for us to stay and not be in the midst of busy SanFran. It is close to the airport but that did not bother us and of course close enough to the city. The only thing that could have been improved was when the concierge purchased online tickets to see Alcatraz, she should have asked for specifics, ie how many adults, children before she completed the online transaction and simply purchased 2 adults. She did go back to purchase 2 more tickets for us but did not mention there was a savings if the 2 additional tickets were for minors. We overlooked the $2 or $5 savings. All in all, everyone at the hotel was friendly and eager to assist. Thank you!

review.title: Hyatt Burlingame-SF Airport is the bomb-diggity
review.reviewText: Hyatt's service was exemplary. The only recommendation I would make is for their signage in the self-parking lot. It was not clear that we were to press the call button when my husband left out (early with the intention of returning to pick me up) so he ended paying another parking fee separate from what we charged to the room.

review.title: Nice stopover
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and clean, and it is convenient to the airport. However, we had to pay for parking, extra $20, and for breakfast, extra $20 each. The breakfast area is very nice and comfortable with all the lush plants around. We felt very relaxed.

review.title: VERY GOOD CHOICE
review.reviewText:
Hotel Is very comfortable, clean, well equiped for business travellers.
Very good value for the price.
I would come back anytime.

review.title: Best SFO hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I were visiting our daughter and her husband in San Francisco. Rather than hassle with city traffic, we decided to stay at SFO. We enjoyed a room on the club floor at the Hyatt Regency Burlingame. The room was comfortable, the breakfast buffet was very good, and the staff is outstanding. This is an unusually good airport hotel.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: Not a lot of eating options in the vicinity within walking distance. The hotel is laid out with a center atrium but only has one elevator bay. If your room is opposite of the elevator, you're walking around the entire permiter of the hotel to get to your room.

review.title: A Review
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nicely appointed, and once I was able to get my bearings, easy enough to navigate around to where I needed to be. My room was clean and spacious, and I was happy to note that one of the channels was a Japanese channel.

Because I didn't have a car, my food options were limited to what was in the hotel (which was a bit pricey for my tastes; especially once the 'deli' closed), a good walk to one of the local mid-priced restaurants, hopping onto the infrequent shuttle to downtown, or taking a shuttle back to the airport and hopping on the BART.

The staff were friendly and helpful whenever I had a question or issue, and the one main issue I had (a mix up with a food order) was promptly rectified with no bad attitude on either end.

review.title: Great SF Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel, free shuttls to and from the airport, and free shuttle to neary shopping! Good restaurants inside the hotel and several others within walking distance.

review.title: never come back again
review.reviewText: next time we plans to San francisco, better reserve small hotel better than famous hotel like that, because even we reserved before but we could not get the room as we reserved.

review.title: Warning to any Families, DO NOT TAKE YOUR KIDS HERE!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I will never stay here again. An extremely loud party was allowed to rampage through out the hotel until well after 2:00 am. No effort was apparently made by any hotel staff to contain or control disruptive behavior. Drunk people missing crucial clothing items where on all floors screaming and running around. Lewd crude behavior was occurring in all public areas of the hotel including main reception area, hallways, elevators, and central promenade area. Multiple calls to the front desk went unanswered, we never could call anyone on the house lines. Behavior continued through the night and into the next day. No mention on check-in was made of the fact that a group had reserved the main ballroom and many of the rooms for a weekend dedicated to exploring and experiencing gay fulfillment (a direct quote from one of the organizer/participants). Regardless of orientation no group should be allowed to behave in such a manner. No decent hotel should allow guest to continue such behavior with out being asked to leave. We would have left if we had transportation to another hotel and it wasn't so late. We had to have our teenager stay in the room due to promiscuous behavior. Not a nice way to spend your vacation time.

review.title: Modern but not impressed just for transit stay
review.reviewText: It seems to be resonable price compared to downtown hotels, but considering the transportation fee to downtown, it does not deserve if there is a vacant room in downtown. (Unfortunately when we stayed, there were no vacant rooms in downtown because of Ladies marathon)

review.title: Perfect Honeymoon Spot
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful inside and out and was the perfect location to tour California like my new husband and I did. We rented a car and made use of our time away but it was always nice to come back to the hotel since the bed was heaven and the hotel staff did everything they could to make our stay so special.

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: Decent hotel. Very little in the imediate vacinity. Somewhat of a distance from SFO despite being an airport hotel. Overall good value.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay at the Hyatt. The room was nice and modern, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and also clean. The only complaint was my daughter was looking forward to the pool, which was supposed to be heated but was too cold to get in.

review.title: Just OK
