review.reviewText: Other than arriving 30 minutes earlier and not being able to check in because no rooms were available (?!!?) the stay was OK. The location is good. I knew about having to pay for parking and as others noted, I do not see the point of a charge since it is not a tourist area. But they can charge, so why not?!

review.title: Unexpected comfort
review.reviewText: We were in town for a long weekend and wanted something affordable. We assumed that an airport hotel would be noisy and geared for business people. It was a great surprise to stay at this very comfortable and very quiet Hyatt. We were less than 3 miles from the airport but there was no noise at all , the service was excellent, and the room was large and very comfortable.

review.title: Good hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Convenient location very close to SFO airport and minutes from shopping areas in Burlingame.

review.title: GREAT STOPOVER
review.reviewText:
I USED THIS HOTEL AS A BREAK I MY TRIP FROM HAWAII TO THE EAST COAST. THE HOT\EL PROVIDED A PLEASANT EVENING AND I WAS
FRESH FOR MY CONTINUING FLIGHT THE NEXT MORNING.

review.title: Too loud for comfort
review.reviewText: Please read my travel experience to get the picture

review.title: So. S.F. Hyatt - Great!
review.reviewText: Everyone on staff was very friendly and helpful. Nobody ignored you when you had a question, something we have experienced in some other hotels. The young lady who checked us in was especially nice and cordial. Look forward to visiting same the hotel in the future.

review.title: Max
review.reviewText: Good

review.title: Nice hotel but overprices and not well kept
review.reviewText: Easy check in and very polite. Only one problem, most of the rooms are extremely far away from the elevator. It is because the hotel is U shaped and the elevator is on one end of the U and not in the middle which would make more sense. Brunch Buffet was very good, but also very expensive. Water in the bathroom did not work properly. It only drizzled out. Not even enough force to wash your hands or brush your teeth. Had to do that in the bathtub.

review.title: nice hotel and will go back
review.reviewText: Although the room I got wasn't the most desirable one, the hotel was nice and what do you expect from a Hyatt.

review.title: Disappointed in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent our 25th anniversary here. We were not overly excited about what we found. There was a coffee maker and coffee, but surprise no coffee pot. T.V. channels were far from impressive and to select and watch a movie 13.99. We did not want to rent a car do to the expense of parking, so we were pretty much out of luck for finding anything to eat in the evening (unless you wanted to pay 20 bucks per person for a simple thing like a hamburger) after returning from site seeing. There was absolutely nothing around within an easy walking distance (escpecially at night). I will say the staff were very pleseant people. Would I recommend this place to others? Sorry but no.

review.title: Would love to go back
review.reviewText:
no problems. everyone was genuinely nice and professional. would recommend to anyone.
thanks

review.title: Living off their name
review.reviewText:
It's a Hyatt, but it's also an airport hotel that's one of the ones further from the airport than other motels that are just as nice but a lot cheaper. You can pay hotel prices for food, or go a block and get a much better meal for the same price. You're nickeled and dimed; very pricey internet, and paying for parking when there are empty parking lots all around.

Next time, it's the Travelodge half a block away.

review.title: Business Traveller's Pick
review.reviewText: A convenient, business-oriented hotel near the San Francisco International Airport. Great value and a fantastic breakfast buffet. Easy freeway access to the 101 and 280, airport to hotel in under 5 minutes.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Great customer service. It would be nice to have a coffee shop available in the evening. They just have the sports bar. But otherwise overall experience was excellent.

review.title: Our next stay will be here!
review.reviewText: I don' know what those people are complaining about! This was a great stay at Hyatt! The room style was modern and very comfortable! Beside that this place is so creativly beautiful, it is also very clean (which is a big thing for me!!) Thanks for making our stay this great!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly. The room was very comfortable.

review.title: Solid hotel for business trips into the Bay Area.
review.reviewText: Solid hotel for business trips into the Bay Area.

review.title: would return if iwas staying the night if frisco
review.reviewText: it was a beautifull hotel but the location is only great if you dont have children and you wat to mait 2hours dinner service for 100 bucks

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Great beds! Very close to airport so convenient. Rooms were clean, quiet, well appointed and very comfortable.

review.title: Hyatt Airport at SF
review.reviewText: This is a great way to save some money if you go to SF. To go to the city, their shuttle will take you to the Airport. Then from there you go in the BART train to the city. It's a nice ride, and a good alternative to renting a car.

review.title: never sleep
review.reviewText: Hotel would be fine if it wasn't right next to the 101 fwy. It felt like i was 'trying' to sleep on the shoulder of the road. The loudest hotel at night that I have ever stayed. Maybe got 2 hours of sleep.

review.title: Very good hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Excellent rooms. You can't go wrong here.

review.title: Comfortable hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Everything was ready as expected at check-in and thereafter. Buffet breakfast in the hotel was always great (had all other meals outside the hotel). There were few other people in the hotel on my first day; that changed on the second day when a single group of 450 people checked-in but there were no logistical problems as the result (although there were more cars in the parking structure, but still not a problem). Quiet all the time. Iron, board, and refrigerator worked fine. Newspaper wasn't consistently delivered. Bathroom can use better ventilation (mirror always fogged and had to be wiped). A few more drawers or shelves would help provide space to hold things and store things. Microwave would be a nice addition.

review.title: Bad Weather? Don't Stay here
review.reviewText: Horrible Customer Service They dont try to accommodate for bad weather be forewarned.

review.title: Depressing
review.reviewText: I have never before written a review but I was so exasperated, I am doing it. This hotel seems like it is about to close (probalby the CA economy, but they should admit it)--I've liked other Hyatts, which is why I booked, but it was awful. The restaurant and wine bar were both closed, room service was mediocre, no minibar, the room needed to be refurbished (old lamps, rug, TV, etc.), didn't provide receipt under door (had to go to front desk), charged for wifi and parking (unlike other airport hotels), used a difficult wifi service, clock was sset to the wrong time, minimal bathroom supplies...it goes on. I was tired, needed a good place to eat and rest, was willing to pay their price (higher than many others) and found everything about it second-rate. But there was toothpaste in the bathroom!

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: It's on convenient location, good size, and good transportation! I would go back here instead of paying $400 for Union Square hotels.

review.title: Absolutely beautiful
review.reviewText: We had a hard time finding a hotel room in the downtown area because there was a conference going on at the time we were going to be there. We opted to stay out near the hotel since we had our car with us. This hotel was absolutely gorgeous and we stayed in a beautiful room. They bumped us up to a suite for free. We also had our two small children with us and they were great about getting us two cribs and also included Johnson and Johnson's baby shampoo, powder and lotion for each of the kids. A nice touch. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great atmosphere and location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay because of the great atmosphere and location. Burlingame, the Airport and San Francisco city are all easily accessed via the free shuttles. The waterfront walkway and running trail are excellent. The staff were very friendly and we were made very welcome by staff on the front desk especially one staff member who knew Australia and New Zealand extremely well.

review.title: Very comfortable airport hotel
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a good night's sleep near the airport, I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are very clean and don't have that typical airport hotel wear. The hotel is atrium style so it has an open feel with a lovely courtyard - many rooms overlook the indoor atrium. The gym is typical - nothing to write home about but certainly acceptable for a quick morning workout. The Starbucks coffee in the atrium deli (opens early in the a.m.) was a nice surprise. Overall service was very good.

review.title: Hyatt SFO
review.reviewText: Good location if you need to stay close to the aiport and nice facilities if you are looking to find everything on site.

review.title: They charge you almost $20 to go in and out of the parking structure...
review.reviewText: ...when you're a guest. Each time. That's a complete rip-off. Otherwise, nice hotel.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved my stay at the Burlingame Hyatt. The rooms were attractive, customer service was friendly, beds were extremely comfortable. On the down side, the hotel restaurant was a little expensive and we spent a lot of time down town so it was a little less convenient than staying down town. The hotel shuttle was very helpful in transporting us to the BART station and the airport, though.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: But...........the Italian resturant was pitiful. We had the worst experience and it was just pain awful. The service was so slow and poor, no professionalism. The only exception was one gentleman. He was a tall, black man and he was very helpful and knew just how upset we were. He gave us a comp chocolate lava cake, he at least tried.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: A beautiful room with a great view of hte Bay. Sports Bar was a happening place. Staff was very curtious. Will stay there again!

review.title: best hotel ever
review.reviewText: one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in i wish i could take the bed and pillows home with me.

review.title: A good hotel but....
review.reviewText: It's really a good and nice hotel, but it's far from the most important points of San Francisco and if you have a car you will need to pay for the parking, what makes any promotion useless, at least if your budget is OK.

review.title: Great service if you have flight out of SFO
review.reviewText: Loved the free valet return for Hertz car rentals. Good, reliable shuttle service to the terminals.

review.title: There was a lamp out in the bathroom and AC was not cold
review.reviewText: Overal it is ok

review.title: Just For The Fun Of It.
review.reviewText: My trip was just for the fun of it and I really enjoyed the hotel. My room was very clean and the service was great. Breakfast was really good and I would recommend the Burlingame Scramble. My waitress and other employees were a pleasure. The courtyard where the restaurant sets, is wonderfully relaxing and if ever I return to the San Francisco area for a stay, I would go back...

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: room was comfortable with a great view of the bay. The only downside was it was not close to local attractions.

review.title: Very nice. Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: We stayed here in late July '09. We had an 8th floor romm w/king bed and used a rollaway for our daughter. The room size was adequate. An exhaust fan in the bathroom would have been good given the humidity. That and having to ask for extra glasses and towels every other day (there were 3 of us) were are only gripes. Hardly worth mentioning. The atrium is very nice and the pool/spa are in good shape. Prices in the restaurant in the atrium are a bit steep. We didn't eat there. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The bell desk recommended a pizza place for delivery one night and it was awesome. Free shuttle to the BART station was handy and they came often. Overall, the hotel is in great shape and the staff are top notch. We would stay there again.

review.title: Nice Place! but . . .
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel and we received a great rate. But, the hidden fees also hurt and have soured me toward all Hyatt Regencies. $18 to park your car per day! $4 if you drink the bottle water left in the room. Room service prices that drive away the middle class! Thanks for the stay, but you will not see me again!

review.title: 4 stars hotel but only worth 2 stars
review.reviewText: We came around 7 pm and the room was not available, we waited for long time to find out the room wasn't cleaned yet, because they said that the guest was check out late (7pm??) and wanted us to wait another 30 minutes or longer, we told them that we need to shower as we need to goto airport, then they gave us a room, queen bed room which is pretty small and its unlike Hyatt at all.. Even motel like Country Inn room is even better than Hyatt.. breakfast also.. not up to "Hyatt"

review.title: very nice hotel but not for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel in general was very nice, staff was friendly and shuttle drivers were professional. The view was not as nice as it could be being on the bay and all. Center atrium was beautiful but loud when there are large crowds, the noise is hard to block out from rooms facing the atrium. If u plan on going into SF a lot, then I suggest a closer hotel. Oh, and there were trash in the hallways from breakfast that were not picked up for 1 day and 1/2. ehhh

review.title: Would stay again but...
review.reviewText: Everything was great except for the bell service. Requested for assistance with luggage never came up. Shouldn't have had to have called more than once for assistance. Otherwise, really nice place.

review.title: Remarkable visit
review.reviewText: There is not much difference physically to distinguish one hotel from another, so what makes the difference is the spirit of the staff. In this case, I felt taken care of to a remarkable degree, without being made to feel like it was a problem when I had a minor complaint. I felt like everyone there was personally dedicated to me having a great time while I was there, without them ever being intrusive. Even the housekeeping staff made me feel like family whenever they saw me.

review.title: San Fran Airport Hyatt
review.reviewText: Typical Hyatt No problems clean, quite, and busiiness friendly. Parking cost is very high

review.title: A Nice Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Very comfortable rooms. Very cordial and helpful staff. Sports bar was not too nice for dinner but Italian restaurant was very good. No place to get a quick hot breakfast early in morning. However deli was nice

review.title: Very Good Service
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and bright. The staff was very helpful and pleasent!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Nice hotel!!!

review.title: Nice hotel. Very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Would have helped to know that parking cost $18. Did not expect that

review.title: Love this place
review.reviewText: The Atrium is a nice touch. As with any hotel, things are pricey here except for the room charge which I find reasonable for the quality and location of the hotel. The only thing that ruined my stay this time was a bunch of rowdy people yelling and screaming outside of my room at all hours of the night. I was too tired to get up and call the front desk. I doubt anyone else called because they wouldn't stop. I woke up to a hall littered with beer cans. haha.

review.title: ok but not many amenities for the money
review.reviewText: Internet connection is $10 / day , parking is $25 / day. No breakfast and the hotel restaruants are expensive for the quality of food that you get. Rooms were clean and the staff friendly but overall you would get a much better value staying somewhere else.

review.title: check your room location
review.reviewText: If you get a room far from the elevators you're in for a hike. Not a problem for most but if you are not up to walking a whole lot after a day of traveling ask the front desk for a room closer to the elevators.

review.title: Not Bad for an Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel had all the expected amenities and easy freeway access. I expected a bit more from a Hyatt (never stayed at one before), but the price was definitely right. One thing still puzzles me though: how did I get a queen-size bed with a king-size on my reservation? (Of course, I could have switched rooms if it weren't for other travellers in my party -- I chose not to move away from them to another floor.)

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We were there for the New Year Holiday so we just basically slept there. However, the hotel was beautiful. Check in/out was easy and quick. The only thing that was wrong with the room was that the refrigerator did not keep anything cold but that was okay being that there was ice always available.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: When I arrived the place was a zoo due to some convention, but then quieted down. The room I got was Bay View so that was nice, although The Atrium side seemed good with the little balconies. The window opened so you can get fresh air and the beds were quite comfy. No microwave or LCD screen, but a small fridge. The bath console was granite and had magnifying mirror. The lobby has a snack bar and cafe style restaurant with Starbucks. Also the pub was good. Only 2 exits from the airport, but not really any good food spots nearby. I would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel would stay again. thanks
review.reviewText: Had a great time in Knuckles Bar staff extremely friendly. Front desk staff very kind. Long walk to the elevator from our room. Would recomend to friends. Easy to get to. Thanks

review.title: Nice hotel, expensive food
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and the staff were accommodating. The rooms were clean and I loved the fact that there was a mini-fridge in the room. The only negative was the expensive food options available to you. A sandwich at the deli starts around seven dollars and lunch for one can cost you up to fifteen dollars or more. There are other restaurants on site but they too are expensive options as well.

review.title: Very clean, nice-looking hotel but forced to pay for parking
review.reviewText: A friend was visiting and she stayed at this hotel. Goods: The room was very clean and nice. I was surprised actually. Whether you have a room facing inside or out, it's nice. Bads: They should upgrade the old-style TV to a plasma or LCD though. I simply "asked" about parking rate in their garage and when it was time to check out, there was a parking charge for the 3 days. Either you pay the overnight rate or you pay hourly. The first hour is more expensive than subsequent hours. I had to bring my hourly parking receipts to the front desk to have them take the charge off.

review.title: Excellent Stay!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the overall presentation.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Well connected from San Fransisco. But that is where everything ends. Even to deliver a spoon, they have a surcharge. Even if you carry your own liquor, they charge you cockage. Everyday parking at the hotel is $18. Very small rooms.

review.title: OK. If you must....No free wi-fi at that price?
review.reviewText: This was a weird hotel. I went there for a conference, but the strange configuration of the place wasn't good for exhibitors or meetings. Everything was around the corner or hidden. I'm sure this set up is great for other types of events, just not this one. The room wasn't as comfortable as even some much cheaper hotels I have stayed at in big cities like DC or NY. No sitting area or drawers in room. It wasn't dirty or out-dated, but not worth what I paid either. No free wi-fi anywhere in hotel. That was probably the straw that broke the camel's back. Free shuttle to downtown Burlingame was a plus. Only stay here if it's convenient because of an onsite conference or you need to be near the airport.

review.title: Guess Beware!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel over billed me. My advice is to make sure you review your statement after you checked out from this hotel. I checked out on 11/7/2008 and still got a transaction charge from this hotel dated 11/12. I paid CASH in the front desk upon my checked out and still billed my debit card for the same amt. I had to e-mail them many times for 2 wks and called the hotel just to resolve the issue. Customer service found out the mistake because I questioned about the charge. It was so frustrating!!! Not to mention the bathroom is dirty and the house keeping are full of attitude. Some doors seems to need a replacement as well, you will find some cracks wood chipping ect. Again, I will never recommend this hotel. In fact I will write a letter to my company regards to this matter.

review.title: Very good, needs a little attention.
review.reviewText: The room was nice, my only complaint there was a running toilet. (Why do so many hotels have running toilets?) The bus service to the airport was excellent! The restaurant was kind of cavernous and empty. The food was fine, but nothing special.

review.title: Recommend Highly
review.reviewText: Very nice rooms and general hotel surroundings. Food at hotel restaurants was excellent.

review.title: Good hotel near to the airport with easy access to the city
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great - I found it a little odd that the window treatments in the room were very lightweight with no blockout lining. Not good for guest who want to be able to sleep late because they travelled all night! Most unusual for a hotel of this quality.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the airport.

review.title: Nice, comfortable close to airport
review.reviewText: We stay near the airport all the time, Marriott, Westin and we REALLY enjoyed the Hyatt, we will make it our first choice when choosing next time.

review.title: far away from downtown
review.reviewText: I only stay there if i dont want to go downtown, hotel must have transport for go to downtown, i only stay there because oracle openworld and they have bus to take us to go downtown. for leisure i am not recommend to stay in this hotel because to far, but hotel service is good.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a beautiful interior atrium and restuarant space, easy travel to downtown San Francisco on Bart. Great pool and hot tub facilities.

review.title: convenience at a fair price
review.reviewText: nice and clean hotel, close to the airport. depending on what room you get the walk through the endless hallway can take some time

review.title: Nice airport hotel
review.reviewText: Overall a pleasant experience, except for travellers arriving late since the restaurants close at 10 and the food at the bar which is the only outlet open at that time is so so. But the room and service are good, especially the convenient free shuttle to the airport, but for the location, the price is on the expensive side, since some good downtown SF hotels are just slightly more.

review.title: Is this really a Hyatt???
review.reviewText: There were large charges for room service delivery, so we decided to eat out. They wanted to charge a $50 corkage fee to bring us a bottle opener, so we saved the wine for another day. There were no desk staff at the front desk for early morning check out, even though this is an airport hotel and I wanted to complain.

review.title: My stay in Hyatt
review.reviewText: This hotel is very big and very crowded with people, service was bad had too wait long just get breakfast hotel itself is old. Will not recommend to anyone and expensive.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very friendly. Room was very clean and modernly decorated. Transportation from hotel to downtown SF was easy and convenient. Conceierge desk was informative but did not have brochures (ie bus schedules) to hand out had to call room with information.

review.title: Comteporary and Stylish
review.reviewText: Breakfast was overpriced.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, great service, there is a $22 valet parking fee per day but my car was brought up instantly. Easy access to the 101 Highway. If you eat breakfast at the hotel go for the buffet, it was great, The first day I went for the small snack bar next to buffet area for breakfastand it sucked!

review.title: A true 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at the Airport is directly across the street from a water-front walking/running path - perfect for enjoying the scenary. We considered staying downtown SanFrancisco, but were glad we didn't as this hotel borders Burlingame, a quaint town with great shops and restaurants. All reasonably priced. An Apple store, there, too. Hotel was top-notch. Rooms were large and comfortable; upscale furnishings.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: You will not be disappointed with your stay, great hotel and service.

review.title: I expected more
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Hyatt Regency Hotels before and have been happy, but I wasn't very happy this time. Parking fees were high, they gave us the wrong room, and the bed was horrible. I felt it was very overpriced for what we got. However, they did have very nice linens.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: It was a last minute trip we had to take to San Francisco so we didn't have a lot of time to plan out the trip and hotel. We were very pleased with this hotel and it was a great location for all the places we had to travel to while in San Francisco.

review.title: Recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: In general, the hotel and the room itself was clean and modern. The furnishings were up-to-date and made us feel we were paying more than the posted price. The hotel staff were very helpful when we asked for directions. They always printed out google maps for us. My family would choose to stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The service at the Hyatt is excellent! I travel to SF every week and stay here because EVERYONE I come in contact with is wonderful!

review.title: good place for one or two nights -- near airport
review.reviewText: it is not as good for a smoker from New York on a ten day stay -- there are only 8 smoking rooms in their whole facility but the indiviual staff members at the desk were quite helpful and friendly -- the manager got us right in the room when made aware of the situation checking in -- too bad that took us 3 hours and $65 in food and drinks to kill time till the room was finally ready

review.title: Typical Regency service and comfort
review.reviewText: Everything great with this Hyatt Regency, they even have a computer terminal in the lobby for quick flight confirmations and boarding passes which saves alot of time at the airport. The $18/night hotel parking garage fees are avoidable. We parked on a side street adjacent to the hotel for free otherwise, great location, five good resturants across the street.

review.title: Great place to stay close to the airport off 101
review.reviewText: Walking distance to many restaurants Great room Convenient parking garage Near Airport (free shuttle) Just off freeway 101 Bike path across the street

review.title: Hyatt Regency
review.reviewText: Greatest hotel experience!

review.title: I would choose it again
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable, good for business but far from down town San Fransisco if the purpose is to see it for the first time.

review.title: Easy access hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, nice and easy to access

review.title: A nice hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: My room was situated beside the elevator. I could hear it going up and down all night. This disturbed my sleep so would suggest not getting rooms from 1-5 on each floor.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Got a great price on a great room/hotel, conveniently located near the airport. Free airport shuttle, too. Desk staff seemed a little untrained at check-in, and had trouble producing my bill at stay's end. Room wasn't cleaned until @ 3:00 pm. I still enjoyed my stay and would choose this hotel again.

review.title: Can't recommended
review.reviewText: Compare with other hotel which is close with this area, such as Crown Plaza and Radisson hotel. They don't charge for parking, this is the first time that I got charge for staying at the hotel. Well, overall, which is good....

review.title: LOVED IT
review.reviewText: I had never satyed in a hotel that was so beautiful and clean. everyone was so nice!

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights there. Not really a 4 star. Did not have King bed at check in; assigned room with 2 doubles. Room was "miles" from the elevator; room overlooked freeway. Hotel has average quality restaurants. Staff very friendly. Nice spa/pool/fitness facilities. Have to pay $ 9.99 a day for wireless internet, which was patchy in the hotel meeting rooms.

review.title: convenient express check in
review.reviewText: You have choice of checking in and get a room key from computer screen at front desk in the hotel; it's so convenient if you arrive late and tired. Room was nice and bed confortable. However, the bathroom showed sign of "aging". Toilet water tank periodically gave noise. You could hear next door flushing toilet.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: We would definitly recomend this hotel as far as being satisfied with service and the overall hotel but it is not the closest hotel to all activities. Everything was at least 20 mins away by taxi which got costly but you can take the free hotel shuttle to the airport and catch the bart for alot cheaper so there is a way around the expense of the taxi.

review.title: wery convenient hotel
review.reviewText: My companion my wife, express high satisfaction so this mean that this hotel is really good.

review.title: OK as an airport hotel
review.reviewText: I think this hotel is fine if you are staying for a night on business or for easy access to the airport. It is a pretty standard Airport Hotel, functional but souless! The bar was Ok and reasonably priced for a hotel bar. The room was pretty standard and the bed comfortable. The hotel was being refurbished when I stayed so some areas were off limits and it was a very long walk from our room to the lift!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, just wished they offered complementary breakfast

review.title: Top Notch Accommodations
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is clean, quiet and has a great sports bar and Italian restaurant. We were extremely satified with our stay!

review.title: Sitting in the dark
review.reviewText: I wanted to surprise my wife with a weekend getaway. Turns out the surprise was on us. On are return back to the hotel after dinner there was no power in the hotel. We were never contacted by anyone at the hotel with a reason or how long of the power outage. Not even a apology or sorry for the inconvenience. Sitting in the dark for hours.

review.title: Close to airport but parking - $18 / day!
review.reviewText: A clean, safe place to stay the night before an early flight, but $18 / day for parking ... gimme a break ... why is it the cheap chains can offer free parking and wireless internet while Hyatt charges for these amenities?

review.title: 4-Diamond Service at affordable prices!
review.reviewText: Very beautiful property conveniently located to the airport (5 minutes) and downtown San Francisco (20 minutes) without the hassle of staying downtown! Outstanding front desk staff, exceeded our expectations and look forward to returning soon! Be sure to request a room overlooking the atrium!

review.title: second time staying and will stay again
review.reviewText: Beds were very comfortable and overall very nice

review.title: Dirty Hotel :Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: There were stains on the bed sheets. So I requested for a replacement but nothing was done. The front desk worker gave me an atitude for wanting the bed sheets to be replaced.. Poor service. Never going back to Hyatt Regency S.F.

review.title: Had a nice weekend
review.reviewText: It was a family friendly hotel. Restaurant had attentive waiters, great quail dinner! Although it was near the airport, there weren't any noise of planes flying overhead.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: A lovely, safe hotel with extremely helpful staff. We stayed on the Regency floor and were very pleased with the room, food and service. A good location for visiting the overall San Francisco area. The hotel shuttle runs 24 hours and takes you to the airport where you can easily take the BART transit into downtown San Francisco (door to door 30-45 minutes). Would definately stay here again.

review.title: very dissastisfied. going to inform better business bureau
review.reviewText: card key would not open self parking or room. Front desk offered nothing to satisfy their customers. Bed dirty had black hair all over mattress pad. Housekeeping never showed up to changed linen. Left hotel without staying the night. Front desk personnel didn't give a hoot. Hotel claims they are charging me for a nights stay when I didn't even stay!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: to be an 4 stars hotel the room was too small, very bad attention from valet parking and was very hard to find parking even in handicap places (because i have handicap sign) and i found 3 cars parked on handicap places with out signs

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Hyatt Burlingame several times before on business. So when I had the opportunity to go there for pleasure, I did not pass it up. It's a beautiful hotel. I love that I can watch planes land from certain views. I also like Knuckles (sports bar) to watch games while I travel. The pool table is fun also. I would definitely stay again if the opportunity arises.

review.title: Better than most in the area
review.reviewText: Beautiful interior, friendly staff. Sports bar nice but understaffed and slow service. Other restaurants nice, good food though expensive. Parking was convienient, said there was a nightly charge, but it did not show up on the bill. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Internet access is NOT free.

review.title: mediocre
review.reviewText: Cracks in the tub,mildew-,not a great hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel...
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was very clean and had a very large center courtyard with beautiful landscaping and restaurant. Great hotel amenities. What would make it an even better place to stay would be if there were more restaurants, movie theatre, etc around. Only 3-4 restaurants within walking distance, not much else...

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: For being a major hotel you would expect the room to have a room safe-nope. But the biggest problem was when I returned to the room at 3 PM the room still had not been serviced by housekeeping!!! Room was nothing special

review.title: Too Old--Not worth Regency Money
review.reviewText: This hotel desperately needs Hyatt standards renovation...there are better values at the airport in newer chain hotels (normally of lesser standards).

review.title: Hyatt regency S.F. Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and well staffed. I needed a cab and it was right there. The hotel front desk people were very helpful. I recommend this hotel for comfort and location.

review.title: A wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay. Friendly, courteous staff and excellent facilities.

review.title: The Greatest
review.reviewText: Very clean. Someone alwaya around to answer your questions Food excellent Slept like a baby Felt safe and secure in my surroundings I was alone on this trip and had no problems there

review.title: My stay in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, but showed its age in the carpets. Service was superb very eager Valets, Bell Caps. Breakfast was a feast. Location provides access to every thing when traveling by car. Parking rates are better than most. When I return I will stay at this hotel.

review.title: Good Hotel for a Great Price.
review.reviewText: Hotel was under construction with most of the atrium blocked from view and only a recording of water playing. Was disappointed with that. Concierge new nothing of the San Francisco area what little advice he gave on tourist attractions such as Pier 39 was wrong. Room was nice and bed comfy. Several places to eat inside the hotel. Only tried the sports bar and it was great. Workout room and pool looked nice, but didn't get a chance to use them. Even with its faults, for this caliber of hotel the price was great.

review.title: good location for my business trip.
review.reviewText: will be best a cooler in room

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: the hotel was beautiful and a wonderful place to stay. We actually got into town much earlier than anticipated, around noon - and the staff was accommodating and we were able to check in early.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: The room we had was very nice and had a great view. The room was always very clean and very polite staff. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean

review.title: Staff was great
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very accomodating and very friendly. There wasn't a staff member that didn't say hi and give a smile.

review.title: Everyone was very friendly and helpful !
review.reviewText: For a very large hotel it was very comfortable to be in. It was just off 101 and a breeze to get to the airport. I forgot my cell phone charger and they found one for me. They had computers there so I could check my e-mail So I didn't have to bring mine. I didn't have to MapQuest directions because the valet guys always checked with me to see if I needed help finding things or wanted directions. The hostess in the resturant told us about a great place to visit and see the ocean Half Moon Bay. To sum it up I felt they went out of their way to make us feel welcomed in this hotel and this is where I'm telling my friends to if they want to see San Francisco!

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: I'd stay at this hotel again - good options for eating (nice restaurant, sports bar, and cafe), as well as an outdoor pool and exercise facility.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The hotel was great but it was a little out of the way if your interested in downtown attractions and eating places

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Very nice place, the only down fall is the elevator. The place is pretty big and it only has elevators on one side of the building! You need to walk a long way if your room is accross the way from the elevators.

review.title: I will consider staying next time I go back to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable.

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: When we returned from San Francisco, we came back to an uncleaned room. We had to request clean towels and just put up with the unmade beds. There was an alarm clock going off in the room next door at 10:30pm and it took two seperate phone calls 20 minutes apart to get it turned off. No one occupied the room In the sports lounge I ordered a beer and a glass of water. My friend ordered water. She was given a dirty look and the only thing brought to the table was my beer. Shuttle service for the hotel was good.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel location and convience of area to bart was the only good thing. The staff at this hotel is great and very friendly. The things that were awful was first one elevator for like 150 rooms per floor and the whole hotel is a round circle so if your room is right in the middle you have to walk so far to get to the elevator, what a pain. Second the bed sheets are awful they don't fit the beds and it is so uncomfortable when they bunch

review.title: Close to Monster Park
review.reviewText: This hotel is near Monster Park and great if you are attending sports functions. It is south of downtown San Francisco and south of the Park, so you do not have to travel thru the city to get from the hotel to the park, makes it nice for a late afternoon/evening game, returning to the hotel is easy. The hotel itself is excellent, and food in the restaurant was excellent as well.

review.title: Could Try Harder
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because we had stayed here before once, a year ago, and had gotten a dazzling room. I guess I just assumed all their rooms were like the one we stayed in before, but the one this time was pretty standard and about half the size. I was disappointed and asked at the front desk about changing to the sort of room we had gotten before. The desk clerk was curiously gruff and the first thing he said was, "I need to see some ID." I showed him my ID and then he told me they only had the type of room I was in and suites. He basically told me the room we had before didn't exist. Even though I would have been willing to pay for an upgrade. Housekeeping seemed a little spotty for a four star hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet, and the shuttle service to the BART station and airport was frequent and reliable. Concierge desk was helpful.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: I am disabled and was there for our son's wedding. I could not have found them more helpful.

review.title: Best of the Best
review.reviewText: I've only been to 3 - 4 5 star hotels before, but this hotel is definitely the model of what a true 5-star hotel should be. The staff is extremely conscientious, very friendly, and just wonderful. I truly appreciated my stay there, and I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: convenient place to stay
review.reviewText: It is close to the airport, very well maintained and not too far from the BART and CAL train stations. Restaurants close too early (10 PM) and if you have not had a meal before returning to the hotel, be prepared to sleep hungry. some rooms have a great view but they cost more.

review.title: Great location for early mornign airport connection
review.reviewText: We we headed to Maui and stayed in S.F. for a fews days. We took a day trip south to Camel and want to stay near the airport for the connecting flight to Maui. Perfect location. There is a great walking path along the bay nor far for the hotel to get in a good walk after dinner. Part of the atrium was undergoing some reconstruction when we were there but it was not a problem and was tastefully blocked off. We would stay here again on out next visit.

review.title: a little bit disappointed
review.reviewText: i felt inconvenience because the hotel was partly under maintenance and parking card did not work well.

review.title: Non existent room service
review.reviewText: If you stay here plan on eating out. When I called room service I was put hold for five minutes and then again. I gave up. Couldn't find a host a the restaurant either and went out to eat.

review.title: Thoroughly disappointed
review.reviewText: check in que was very long, room was very dusty and not properly cleaned, lacked room safe.

review.title: Service and Staff Excellent
review.reviewText: The Staff was outstanding. The building design and layout was impressive and fun to stay there. Renovations were ongoing so the dining choice was less than ideal nevertheless better than most.

review.title: a great bargain
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing, the lobby was gorgeous surrounded by beautiful garderns and fountains. I specially like the fact that the rooms were kept spotless, also the staff was great they were very friendly and helpfull.

review.title: it was a hotel that the family would love
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the people that worked there were very polite and they caterd to your comfort and to make you feel like you were at home.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel floors were very large, but only had a single bank of elevators; our room was as far as possible from the elevators. The beds were hard, and pillows and comforter were down--I'm allergic to those. There were serveral burn marks on the floor and in the bathroom, seemingly from an iron. The fan for the heater/AC ran constantly, making the air super-dry. Two days in a row, we didn't get any clean washclothes because the cleaning cart had run out before reaching our room...

review.title: Would definetely stay here again!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was, considering we got such an excellent price! Parking was a bit expensive, but we knew about it beforehand. The staff was friendly and helpful. The atrium is beautiful! Tip: Ask for a room close to the Elevator.

review.title: Would definitely go back...
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Staff were friendly and even did their best to accommidate an early check-in request. The atrium and view from the room were very nice. Only drawback, had to pay for overnight parking, then again it's the norm at most places in the area.

review.title: very nice and convenient parking
review.reviewText: The restaurant is very nice, good food.

review.title: Way too noisy! The doors slam and it shakes your whole room all night
review.reviewText: People sound like they are in the room with you. The walls are very thin and they talk and party outside of the room. The doors slammed several times all through the night. We weren't told there would be a fee for parking, so that was a surprise. The people at the front desk were cold and unapproachable.

review.title: Okay but not a 4 star
review.reviewText: Room was not cleaned well (peanut shells under the couch). Furniture looked very old... garage sale quality. Not what you expect when you stay at a Hyatt. Some of the courtesy van drivers (shuttle to/from airport) are just down right rude and may be hard to understand so be prepared.

review.title: Great Deal for the Money !
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in this great hotel. If you don't mind staying outside the city this hotel is an excellent deal for the money. VERY nice !

review.title: Excellent in-house restaurant
review.reviewText: Nice atmosphere, typical of Hyatt Regency.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Thanks for the good rate.

review.title: I was impressed!
review.reviewText: Great linens, down comforters.

review.title: overall value of the hotel
review.reviewText: The rating categories listed above do not take the overall value of the experience into account. While I rated all of the questioned categories relatively high, I felt that the cost of the hotel compared with others in the area was high. And, the cost of meals and drinks was also high. The place was nice, but it was also very expensive. Overall value for the cost was not that high.

review.title: Above average
review.reviewText: 45 minutes to Downtown via Shuttle and BART

review.title: Hyatt San Fran Airport is the a great Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is a great hotel, nice view of the bay if your room has one. Parking garage is a little bit pricy.

review.title: A good choice for an airport hotel
review.reviewText: A cut above many of the airport hotels I've stayed at. Great location for doing business south of SF without fighting the traffic. My stay worked out well all around. My only complaint is the layout of the hotel means that, if you get a room that is not near the elevator bank, you can literally spend 5-10 minutes walking from the elevator to your room.

review.title: Great hotel to stay at in San Fran
review.reviewText: We are very please with the Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport Hotel, which is a great hotel to stay at while visiting San Fran, for it is close to the airport, with a view of the runway, away from all the hustle and noise of the City. Like the people at the hotel who are very helpful and friendly.

review.title: not well maintained
review.reviewText: This hotel is over-priced, not well maintained, needs updating and the food is way over-priced. In addition to general appearance, the television did not work, the towel rack was broken and the carpet was badly stained

review.title: Warm inviting hotel
review.reviewText: The check in and out went very smoothly. Staff was friendly and helpfu. The rooms were well maintained and comfortable. I liked the individual coffee in the rooms.

review.title: Nice way to arrive in San Fran
review.reviewText: Flew in late to SF, grabbed the hotel shuttle and, even with a mix up on reservations, got a great night's sleep. The hotel folks were very helpful, room and breakfast were great, and I took the shuttle back to the airport to the BART station and headed downtown. It was a lovely way to start the trip.

review.title: beautiful hotel. but very poor customer hotel service by staff.
review.reviewText: The fruit tray left for our anniversary had rotten fruit. The maid did not clean our room. The business center played games on computer instead of helping us. The blow drying and alarm clock did not work. The managers were not helpful in correcting any of the problems.

review.title: Snoring Neighbor, elevators far away
review.reviewText: The accomodations were decent...what you would expect from Hyatt. However, the rooms are poorly sound-proofed, and we could hear our neighbor snoring so loudly that he might as well have been in the room with us. Also, ask for a room near the elevator. Some of the rooms are quite a distance from the elevators, given the less than ingenious layout of the hotel...unless you like that much exercise when you're already tired.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: It is an excellent hotet with lovely, tranquil surroundings.

review.title: Outstanding in every regard
review.reviewText: Exemplary service. catered to my every need

review.title: Very good choice
review.reviewText: This is a good choice if you are planning to drive to nearby cities like Carmel or Napa Valley. Is located 5 min from the airport and 15 min from SF. and you don't have to to pay the high parking prices of SF.

review.title: A good choice in the Bay Area
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport in February 2005 to attend a wedding at the nearby Kohl Mansion in Burlingame. Turned out to be a good choice. There was easy access to the 101 freeway and easy access to the rest of Burlingame. Everything was great - room was nice, staff was friendly. Valet parking was especially nice in the pouring rain! It's a good choice for a Bay Area hotel. We will stay there again on another visit.

review.title: Somewhat impressed
review.reviewText: Overall not a bad place to stay.

review.title: Our Stay
review.reviewText:
Thank you Expedia for the great price!

We weren't ready for a the little surpises;
1. $4.50 bottles of water in the room.
2. $12.00 continental breakfast (skimpy).
3. $15.00 parking fees (self parked).
4. $2.25 12 oz cup of coffee.
5. $3.25 bagel with cream cheese (you spread cc cup).

If you don't care about the above, but a simply looking for a wonderfully appointed hotel, The Hyatt Regency SFO is an excellent choice.

Thanks again.

review.title: "Comfortable rooms, friendly staff"
review.reviewText: My room was comfortable and roomy.  The bed was comfortable.  I was able to control the heat which is not as common as you might think.  The hotel is very attractive.  The shuttle was on time even at 4:30 in the morning.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  I would stay there again.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean.

review.title: In and Out Convenience at SFO

review.title: Peninsula Elegance
review.reviewText: Location, cleanliness, beauty and excellent service combine to equal hospitality elegance.  they are found in the Burlingame Hyatt Regency.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: A great hotel with a lot of services right in the building including three restaurants (one was pretty expensive) and a workout room. The free wireless internet made doing business very easy. Staff was very nice and parking was easy. Bedding was great- soft cotton instead of the usual hotel polyester (yuck). Ask for a bay view room. The hotel was really easy to find from the airport and you can take the free shuttle if you don't need to rent a car.
